jobs_data.title: Java Developer for IAM Team - SCIB Málaga
jobs_data.description: Country: Spain SCIB CISO is looking for a Junior Java Developer for IAM Team based in our Málaga office. WHY YOU SHOULD CONSIDER THIS OPPORTUNITY Santander Corporate & Investment Banking (SCIB) is Santander's global division that supports some of the world's most complex and sophisticated corporate and institutional clients, offering customized services and value-added wholesale products to best meet their needs. We embrace a strong risk culture and all of our professionals at all levels are expected to take a proactive and responsible approach toward risk management. Santander is proud of being an organization where there are equal opportunities regardless of gender identity, culture and disability. Our mission is to contribute to help more people and business prosper. What You Will Be Doing As a Java Developer, you will be part of the team that develops, maintains an evolves an in-house IAM Software that helps managing the Authorization of several other applications used both by employees and SCIB Clients. You will be both developing new software and new infrastructure as well as maintaining the existing one and assisting on the configuration of the engine needed to service every app. We need someone like you to help us in different fronts: -Design and Develop new functionalities for the Authorization Engine. -Deploy, Manage and Maintain the core software and its infrastructure. -Explore, Design and develop new pieces of software that connect our IAM Authorization Software to new technologies. -Configure the Authorization Model designed to manage the applications onboarded in our Software. -Assist the “Integration & Discovery” teams during the design of the Authorization Model. -Help complying with Audit and SCIB’s internal security requirements. -Assist during stress tests, Disaster Recoveries and other test. Experience -2- years of experience in development teams. EDUCATION -Graduate/Licentiate/Master in Computer Science, Telecommunications Engineering, or similar education. Skills & Knowledge -Experience in development teams using Java (microservices architecture, APIs), Spring Boot, Maven, Spring Batch, Spring Cloud Stream, Javascript, SQL & Oracle databases, Framework testing (Postman). -Continuous Integration Experience: Github, Jenkins. -APIs knowledge (REST & Open API, software design patterns). -Cloud Computing Infrastructure Knowledge (PaaS, Openshift, Kubernetes, Docker). -Agile Tools Experience: Kanban, Jira, Confluence. -B2 English and fluency Spanish. Other Information Other knowledge in cybersecurity will be valued: -DevSecOps skill (Secure Software Development Life Cycle, Security in DevOps Processes etc.) -Cybersecurity knowledge and certification If you want to know more about us, follow us on: https://www.linkedin.com/company/santander-corporate-investment-banking/ https://es.linkedin.com/company/banco-santander https://www.betechwithsantander.com/en/home #SCIB

jobs_data.title: Application Operations Engineer
jobs_data.description:
We are PlanetPlanet is a large international cross-border digital fintech payments company, operating in 60 locations across the world and providing a range of services to over 300,000 luxury merchants and 100 acquiring banks. We have grown rapidly over the last seven years and increased seven times in value over this period based on a combination of both organic and acquisition-led growth. The travel and tourism market that we operate in continues to show consistent growth, underpinned by megatrends such as the expansion of middle classes across the world and the desire for Asian shoppers in particular to purchase authentic luxury goods outside their home countries.This growth is set to continue, with ambitious plans to double the business in three years delivering market share expansion in a growing market. Now, with over 1,500 employees spread across five continents, we are an international payment services provider.
About the RoleWe are looking for a multi-talented Systems Operations Engineer to offer skills and experience with a strong track record of designing, building, and maintaining a production environment.These skills will be necessary in helping Planet to digitally transform our core offerings, through modernising and scaling its environments to meet the needs of our customers.
What you will doYou will join the Systems Operations team in:      -Develop as an SME for all production applications collaborating with all other ITSM and development teams.
-Responsibility to diagnose and troubleshoot problems and issues in the production environment.
-Integrating with development teams as part of SDLC process.
-Ownership of the disaster recovery function in the Planet business continuity plan.
-Ensure a consistent approach to change management of production applications, in line with defined processes for all ITSM and development teams.
-Continuously review environments with development and infrastructure teams to ensure service uptime targets are achieved and support our future growth needs.
-Research new technologies to enhance production applications to improve service uptime and reliability.


Who you are      -Strong technical leadership skills.
-Highly energetic and ambitious.
-Excellent analytical, organizational & communication skills.
-Have a passion for simplification and efficiency/process improvement.
-The ability to organise and prioritise workloads while acting on own initiative.
-Inclusive approach to work and interest in working across a global team.


What you will need  to bring to Planet      -IT, Electronics degree or relevant experience.
-Networking knowledge.
-Advanced Linux OS knowledge.
-SQL knowledge.
-Scripting or any other programming language is a plus (ex. Python/PowerShell).
-Configuration Management Platform knowledge is a plus (SCCM/SCOM, Ansible, Puppet, Chef etc)
-Azure or AWS admin knowledge is a plus
-Any Container-based solution is a plus (eg. Kubernetes)
-Exposure to JIRA and Confluence (ITIL/Agile)
-Fluent English (spoken and written); Other language is an asset (French, German, Spanish, etc.).
-Availability to work shifts/nights/weekends.
-Knowledge of the payments industry is an advantage.


Your skills and our Values  We search for better - We celebrate differences - We go beyond expectations - We grow together.

jobs_data.title: Front-End Software Engineer (Data platforms & Tools Dev. Team)
jobs_data.description: 📍 Location: Office in Barcelona [Spain]. 📅 Date of Publication: 01/11/2024 🧬 About Us: The Centro Nacional de Análisis Genómico (CNAG) is one of the largest Genome Sequencing Centers in Europe. The CNAG Consortium aims to carry out large-scale projects in DNA/RNA analysis for the improvement of quality of life in collaboration with the Spanish, European and International Research Community. CNAG researchers participate in major International Genome Initiatives such as the Human Cell Atlas (HCA), the International Cancer Genome Consortium (ICGC), the International Human Epigenome Consortium (IHEC), the International Rare Diseases Research Consortium (IRDiRC), the European Reference Genome Atlas (ERGA) and the European Infrastructure for life-science information (ELIXIR), as well as in several EU-funded projects. 🎯 The Role We have an opening for a Front-end Software Engineer to play a key role in several cancer, rare diseases and immunology related projects, such as Instand-NGS4P (https://www.instandngs4p.eu/), 3TR (https://3tr-imi.eu/) and Solve-RD (https://solve-rd.eu/). Specifically, for Instand-NGS4P, the aim is to develop a standardised Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) workflow from NGS data analysis to medical-decision making for common and rare adult and paediatric cancer. The workflow will leverage, among other, the current RD-Connect Genome Phenome Analysis Platform (https://platform.rd-connect.eu/), with the objective to cover data management, clinical and genome data integration, genome analysis pipelines, variant annotation, interpretation, and reporting. For the 3TR project the aim is to integrate different type of omics data and be able to analyse and visualize those datasets. With the supervision of the Lead of the Data Platforms and Tools Development Team and in collaboration with cancer specialists, bioinformaticians and software engineers, the successful candidate will implement the UI features for the relevant projects. The successful candidate will join the Data Platforms and Tools Development team, coordinated by Dr. Davide Piscia (https://www.cnag.crg.eu/teams/bioinformatics-unit/data-platforms-and-tools-development). The team is part of the CNAG Bioinformatics Unit (led by Dr. Sergi Beltran), which has over 30 members and offers continuous growth and support on a professional level. The team works in a stimulating scientific environment, applying state-of-the-art technologies to breakthrough research projects in Genomics that have an impact on people’s health. ✍️ His/Her responsibilities include: -Design and implement the User Interface with a JS framework ( Reactjs, Vuejs,etc.) -Gather the UI and UX requirements with the data analyst specialists -Collaborate with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability 💼 Whom would we like to hire? -Bachelor degree or Master degree in Computer science or related fields -A minimum experience of 2 year in a Software related position, preferentially as Front-end software engineer. -Proven experience in coding in JavaScript, Typescript, or other programming languages. -Experience with HTML and CSS. -Experience with source control system as git. -Ability to fast translate requirements to prototype and good eye for design. -Good organizational, prioritizing, communication and interpersonal skills. -Good spoken and written English. 💼 Nice to have: -Experience with genomics and clinical data. -Experience with spa framework (React JS, Vue.js, Svelte, Angular, etc.) -Experience with CSS framework (Bootstrap, Material UI) -Experience implementing mobile application and/or porting web UI to mobile devices. -Experience with front-end testing (Selenium, Cypress) 💼 The Offer -Contract duration: 2 years -Estimated annual gross salary: Salary is commensurate with qualifications and consistent with our pay scales. -Target start date: as soon as possible ✅ Benefits We provide a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructures, and unique professional career development opportunities. We offer and promote a diverse and inclusive environment and welcomes applicants regardless of age, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation. We are committed to reconcile a work and family life for our employees and are offering the opportunity to benefit from annual leave and flexible working hours. We look forward to receiving your application and discovering how you can contribute to CNAG's success! 🚀 📧 How to Apply: All applications must include: -A complete CV including contact details. -Contact details of two referees. All applications must be addressed to Mireya Fernández - mireya.fernandez@cnag.eu Deadline: Please submit your application by 30/11/2024 🌐 See the CNAG Career site at our website: https://www.cnag.eu/jobs # sequencing for a better life

jobs_data.title: IoT and Edge Computing Engineer
jobs_data.location: Palos de la Frontera, Andalusia, Spain
jobs_data.description: WHY CHOOSE SNGULAR?People are drawn to SNGULAR for projects that use cutting-edge technology, and they stay because they get to work alongside great professionals. Plus, we offer the following:🙋‍♂️ People First: We’re a collaborative, people-centered company where YOU and your perspective are always valued. Our top value is “People before results.” Sound nice? Well, at SNGULAR, we make it a reality.📈 Growth and Continuous Training: We have a startup spirit with the infrastructure of a large organization (we’re 1,300+ strong). You’ll have opportunities for professional growth—learn new skills, gain certifications, or become a team lead. Step out of your comfort zone however YOU want!🏋️‍♀️ Amazing Benefits: (detailed at the end), including a Wellbeing Pack to support our physical and mental wellness.At SNGULAR, we foster an inclusive culture built on respect, equal opportunity, and proactive work ethics. We’re humble, maintain a team spirit, and don’t forget to keep a positive attitude.Learn why Sngular is a #BestPlaceToGrow. POSITION OVERVIEWWe’re looking for an IoT and Edge Computing Engineer to develop and design tech solutions for IoT/IIoT and edge computing systems. The ideal candidate should have experience in developing large-scale distributed applications, be familiar with cloud environments, and have skills in managing industrial devices and technologies. This role requires the availability to commute to our facilities in Huelva three days per week (candidates from Sevilla or Badajoz will also be considered). WHAT WILL YOU DO? -Design and develop IoT/IIoT solutions to improve connectivity and efficiency in industrial systems. -Implement and maintain edge computing architecture and distributed applications, optimizing data transmission and storage between devices and the cloud. -Configure and manage IoT devices (sensors, controllers, gateways) to ensure integration with company systems. -Collaborate on cloud implementations (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud), working with container technologies like Docker and Kubernetes to deploy and orchestrate microservices. -Ensure embedded device integration and hardware selection, such as PLCs, multi-protocol routers, and industrial sensors. -Develop microservices in languages like Python, Scala, or Java, working with messaging and data transmission architectures. TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS -At least 3 years of demonstrable experience in a similar role, specializing in IoT/IIoT and edge computing systems development. -Bachelor’s degree in Industrial, Electronics, or Telecommunications Engineering, ideally with a focus on electronics or automation. -Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Scala, and Java for microservices development. -Experience with public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), particularly AWS IoT services like IoT Core, Greengrass, SiteWise, Kinesis, S3, QuickSight, SageMaker, etc. -Knowledge of container orchestration such as Docker and Kubernetes. -Experience in configuring and managing IoT devices (sensors, controllers, gateways, etc.). -Ability to program and work with embedded systems and communication hardware: PLCs, Gateways, data acquisition cards, sensors, and wireless communication systems like multi-protocol routers (WIFI, BLE, LoRAWAN, HART, Zigbee, etc.). -Experience with sensor network data protocols like MQTT, AMQP, HTTPS, and TCP. -Experience with industrial protocols like OPC-UA and MODBUS. -Knowledge of low-code development tools like Node-RED or Apache Nifi. -Experience with deployment/provisioning tools like Ansible, Terraform. -Practical knowledge of messaging queues, stream processing, and highly scalable data storage. -Familiarity with Agile and DevOps development practices and technologies: Agile (Scrum, Kanban, etc.), CI/CD, DevOps, IaC, Automation, API-first, Microservices. -Advanced English for effective communication in technical environments and international collaboration. PERKS👨‍🎓 Access to continuous learning: individual budget for training, certifications, unlimited Udemy access, language classes, and internal training dynamics.🏠 Flexible working hours, remote work, and the option to work from our Hubs.📅 22 vacation days + birthday off + 2 days for technical events + December 24th and 31st off.🌞 Wellbeing Pack: support for physical and mental wellness.💵 Flexible compensation.🎉 Team-building dynamics and events.🎁 Welcome Pack.💻 Choice of equipment (Windows/Mac).🚀 Additional initiatives for earning bonuses: employee referrals, speaking at events, technical articles, etc. And last but not least: because we’re Sngular!💙 We have virtual gatherings every Friday, celebrations, and spaces where you can express yourself, propose changes, and be part of them. SNGULAR is committed to environmental protection, conducting the hiring process 100% digitally, and avoiding travel and paper use. We care about environmental resources and work to achieve our sustainability goals.

jobs_data.title: Data Engineer
jobs_data.description:
🚀 ¡Únete a nuestro equipo como Data Engineer! 🚀
¿Tienes una sólida experiencia en Data Warehousing y Business Intelligence? ¿Te apasiona diseñar y gestionar infraestructuras de datos escalables y seguras? ¡Te estamos buscando! En este rol, serás responsable de asegurar la calidad y eficiencia de nuestros sistemas de datos, así como de liderar proyectos clave en el sector de telecomunicaciones.
Tus responsabilidades incluirán:🌐 Diseñar y mantener arquitecturas de Data Warehouse escalables y alineadas con los objetivos de negocio del cliente.🛠️ Supervisar y optimizar procesos ETL para garantizar la correcta integración de datos desde múltiples fuentes.📈 Implementar y gestionar procesos de calidad de datos, asegurando la precisión y consistencia.⚙️ Optimizar el rendimiento de bases de datos y consultas para mejorar la experiencia de uso de datos.🔒 Asegurar el cumplimiento de políticas de seguridad y normativas de privacidad (e.g., GDPR).🤝 Liderar la implementación y supervisión de proyectos, coordinando equipos y manteniendo la comunicación con el cliente.
¿Tienes experiencia en esto?
      -  Experiencia en modelado de datos para DWH corporativos.
-  Experiencia en desarrollo sobre BigQuery (particiones, clusters, views).
-  Exeriencia en la Definición de pipelines ETL/ELT eficientes.
-  Exeriencia en la optimización de consultas SQL para procesamiento masivo.
-  Familiaridad con herramientas de ingesta como Dataflow, Pub/Sub.
-  Experiencia en Limpieza, transformación y estandarización de datos crudos.
-  Experiencia en la integración con diversas fuentes de datos (APIs, sistemas on-premises, streaming).
-  Experiencia en el diseño de esquemas relacionales y desnormalizados (estilo Star/Snowflake).
-  Experiencia en la creación de datamarts enfocados en casos de uso específicos.


Soft Skills
      -  Capacidad para traducir problemas de negocio en soluciones técnicas basadas en datos.
-  Trabajo en equipo con ingenieros de datos y analistas para garantizar la coherencia y escalabilidad de las soluciones.
-  Gestión de stakeholders y presentación de resultados.


¿Qué se ofrece?
      -Proyecto en empresa líder del sector telecomunicaciones (MUY VALORABLE EXPERIENCIA EN EL SECTOR).
-Modelo híbrido 2/3 días oficina/remoto.
-Salario acorde a experiencia presentada(50K-65K) de entre 5 y 8 años.


¡Esperamos tu postulación! 🌟

jobs_data.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Join a team of cybersecurity professionals and help Swiss Re to fulfil its mission in making the world more resilient. As a DevOps Engineer, you'll be immersed in a challenging project, promoting good development practices and establishing an engineering culture as part a team focus on vulnerability management and engineering. What's more, you'll be working in a hybrid setup, perfectly balancing work from home and the office premises.

About The Team

The Security Team is the focal point for all security activities across Swiss Re. We are responsible for cybersecurity engineering and operations, governance, risk, and compliance. We define and advance the company's security strategy. As a part of the Security Team, the Customer IAM team provides a user-friendly experience for external customers of IAM services within Swiss Re. We're looking for an experienced professional with a passion for SDLC automation and technology

In your role, you will…  

      -Focus on operating the current and future new architecture in a high availability setup with ambitious SLAs  
-Use DevOps tools to maintain IaC, automate changes and implement CI/CD delivery, developing and enhancing pipelines in ADO  
-Build and maintain infrastructure as code to support the solution and ensure security compliance  
-Fix, improve and advance infrastructure while solving underlying issues  
-Collaborate with team members to plan features, analyse requirements and ensure application scalability and reliability  
-Identify and eliminate toil by automating (automate infrastructure provisioning and deployments)  
-Develop and implement automated testing procedures to identify vulnerabilities and ensure that new code doesn't introduce new security flaws  
-Work with development and security teams to ensure that security is integrated into the development process from the beginning  
-Work with QA experts to ensure our solutions and integrations meet high expectations for reliability and availability  
-Contribute to the setup and configuration of the solution, implementing and maintaining configuration management  
-Contribute to technical documentation and support of the solution  
-Support production and the continuity of our services, troubleshooting and resolving complex systems and deployments issues  
-Manage and monitor any resources and services  
-Contribute to Swiss Re's Healthy and transparent risk culture where everyone engages in continuous risk accountability activities



Your Qualifications

Nobody is perfect and meets 100% of our requirements. If you, however, meet some of the criteria below and are curious about the world of identity and access management inside a well-established cybersecurity infrastructure, we'll be more than happy to meet you!

What We Need From You

      -3+ years of relevant work experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role  
-Basic understanding of Config management (Decoupling app code from config)  
-Basic understanding of Security Best Practices (authN/authZ , safeguarding sensitive information through proper secrets handling techniques)  
-Basic understanding of Software artifacts and repositories (Artifactory, Docker registry, rpm, npm, nuget, pypi, maven ...)  
-Basic understanding of Code Quality and Security Tools (e.g. SonarQube, NexusIQ, AquaScan, others, ...)  
-Proficiency in two programming/scripting languages (e.g., Bash, Python, PowerShell).  
-Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix or Windows server systems.  
-Basic knowledge of relational databases and SQL.  
-Solid understanding of networking, including DNS, load balancing, firewalls.  
-Ability to independently troubleshoot networking issues.  
-Experience with IaC technologies (e.g., terraform, Ansible, Puppet, Chef).  
-Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).  
-Practical experience with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP).  
-Communicate clearly in writing to create technical documentation for simple systems  
-Understanding of more advanced git operations using commands (stash, rebase, patch) and ability to handle merge conflicts  
-Hands-on experience in IT operations, system administration or other applicable experience  
-Experience with agile software development methodologies (e.g: Scrum, Kanban), CICD processes, automation for release deployment processes and DevOps  
-A methodological, organized approach, proficient at prioritizing tasks and driving objectives to completion, reporting any impediment along the way  
-Good interpersonal skills in spoken and written English  



Nice-to-have  

      -A degree in Computer Science or comparable knowledge  
-Understanding of technologies related to information security, vulnerability management, and Identity & Access Management  
-Experience with diverse IT technologies  
-Experience with security-related tools such as vulnerability scanners or intrusion detection/prevention systems  
-Experience with agile development and DevOps methodologies  
-Experience with Azure and Azure Devops /CICD tools  



We provide feedback to all candidates via email. If you have not heard back from us, please check your spam folder

Role

For Spain, the base salary range for this position is between [EUR 41,000] and [EUR 68,000] (for a full-time role). The specific salary offered considers:

      -the requirements, scope, complexity and responsibilities of the role,
-the applicant's own profile including education/qualifications, expertise, specialization, skills and experience.



In the situation where you do not meet all the requirements or you significantly exceed these, the offered salary may be below or above the advertised range.

In addition to your base salary, you may be eligible for additional rewards and benefits including an attractive performance-based annual bonus

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Keywords

Reference Code:  132000

jobs_data.title: Desarrollador/a Fullstack Node/React/Arquitectura Hexagonal/Testing
jobs_data.description:
En  HAYS  estamos colaborando con una importante empresa del sector de diseño de lámparas e iluminación para interiores fundada en 1979. Tiene más de 100 empleados y su sede se encuentra en Barcelona. Su misión es crear ambientes con estilo, utilizando la iluminación para aportar soluciones eficaces que tengan un impacto positivo en la vida de las personas. Aspira a revolucionar el diseño de iluminación, desafiando sus reglas y proponiendo una nueva visión holística y aumentada que va más allá de la luz para integrar la materialidad, la composición y el uso del espacio.
Actualmente buscan un perfil de  Desarrollador/a Fullstack (MERN) Senior  para incorporarse a su equipo.
¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?
• Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener API robustas y sistemas de backend usando código bajo, con pila Javascript (MongoDB, Express.js, Node.js).• Implementar y mantener las integraciones con sistemas externos, garantizando un flujo de datos sin interrupciones y la compatibilidad del sistema.• Refactorizar y optimizar la base de código existente para mejorar el rendimiento, la capacidad de mantenimiento y la escalabilidad.• Seguir las mejores prácticas y las normas de codificación para garantizar un código de alta calidad y la adhesión a los estándares de la industria.• Garantizar la seguridad e integridad de los sistemas backend, implementando las medidas de seguridad y protocolos necesarios.• Proporcionar retroalimentación constructiva para mejorar la calidad del código y mantener la consistencia.• Mantenerse al día con las últimas tecnologías y tendencias de la industria, mejorando continuamente sus habilidades y conocimientos.
¿Cuáles son los requisitos?
• Experiencia de al menos 3 años en puestos similares.• Sólida experiencia en el desarrollo de backend, específicamente con MongoDB, Express.js, Node.js y React• IMPRESCINDIBLE experiencia con Arquitectura Hexagonal y/o TDD, DDD o realizando testing• El conocimiento de Docker y tecnologías de contenedorización es deseable.• Competencia en el diseño y desarrollo de API REST e integración de sistemas externos.• Experiencia en refactorización y optimización de la base de código existente para mejorar el rendimiento y la escalabilidad.• Familiaridad con sistemas de bases de datos como MongoDB y MySQL.
¿Qué ofrecemos?
• Proyecto estable.• Remoto 4 días a la semana.• Localización: Gavà, Barcelona.• Horario de oficina.

jobs_data.title: Business Intelligence Developer
jobs_data.description:
ClearPeaks is a specialist consulting firm delivering services and solutions in "Everything Data" - Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Big Data & Cloud, and Web & Mobile Applications. Founded in 2000, we have been a trusted partner to our customers in over 15 industry verticals and functional areas, with operations spanning Europe, Middle East, the United States, and Africa.
ClearPeaks is part of a strategic alliance with synvert, a group of six successful full-service Data & Analytics (D&A) consulting firms, with a clear goal to become one of EMEA's largest D&A consulting companies.
Our services are based on the latest market-leading enterprise technology platforms, and delivered by a dynamic team of expert consultants. Our strength lies in our ability to efficiently deliver customer insight and value, gained through our decades of experience with real-world challenges.
As BI Developer, you will have the chance to generate solutions, bring new ideas and improve all your skills by working in a variety of projects with our clients world-wide. At ClearPeaks, there are endless opportunities to get involved in different projects bringing innovative ideas while being part of leading-edge teams who are always innovating and evolving in the BI field.

Responsibilities
      -Participate in all stages of the project development lifecycle such as requirements gathering, implementation, User Acceptance Testing (UAT), deployment, etc.
-Design and implement ETL processes using different ETL tools.
-Manage BI tools to perform good logical models.
-Develop visual reports, dashboards and KPI scorecards.


Requirements
      -Ideally Computer Science Engineering, Informatics, Statistics or other degree with interest in the Business Intelligence field.
-Fluent English both written and spoken.
-Minimum of 3 years of experience in the BI field with the ability to:
-Understands the ETL process and develops mappings according to it (experience with any of these tools: Informatica, SSIS or ODI).
-Proficient in making SQL queries to contrast the development.
-Should have knowledge and skills for secondary tools such as Microsoft Azure.
-Customer oriented with excellent communication and presentation skills.
-Proactive, team player, committed and constant willingness to improve.
-Analytical, problem solving and creative.
-Able to pick up on new data tools and concepts quickly.
-Excited about international business experience.



Our offer to you!
      -Be part of an international and talented team, enjoying an excellent work environment where people are passionate about what they do.
-Attractive salary according to experience and knowledge provided.
-Flexible working schedule

jobs_data.title: Computer Vision ML Engineer
jobs_data.description:
NTT DATA is the 6th biggest IT Service Company in the world with more than 100.000 professionals and a turnover of more than 15 billion euros.  
We at NTT DATA Spain make the difference by being close to our clients, exceeding expectations, managing proactively our projects and customers and focusing on quality and selecting employees with the right mindset to make our company grow. The Group has the ambitious goal to position within the TOP 3 worldwide. We have been awarded Best Place to work in Spain for 4 consecutive years.  
Computer vision has experimented fast-growing in the last years and thereby we are currently looking for a  Computer Vision ML Engineer. The position can be based in Spain (Madrid, Barcelona, La Coruña, among others), even if the geographical scope is Europe.  What are we looking for?  
We are seeking a  ML Engineer specialized in Computer Vision  to our team to take on the technical design and implementation in projects within the scope of our Computer Vision team inside the AoE of IA, working in initiatives for top-tier organizations.  We are looking for a professional who brings his knowledge and experience in artificial intelligence focused on computer vision with the following characteristics:  
Must:  
      -Knowledge in traditional computer vision and image processing (edge detection, gradients, morphological operations, ...)  
-Machine and Deep Learning (Transformers, Auto-Encoders / Decoder Networks, Residual Networks, CNNs, GANs)  
-Proficiency in one or many: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, OpenCV, CUDA, TensorRT, ONNX  
-Hands on experience in production for computer vision projects.  
-Experience in real-world vision data processing, data augmentation, labelling, fine-tuning, training.  
-Experience working in one or many cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure) specially working with computing resources (i.e. AWS EC2) and ML frameworks (Sagemaker, Vertex, Azure ML, Databricks).  


It’s a plus:  
      -Deploying and scaling computer vision models and machine learning pipelines to cluster in the cloud or on-premises, e.g. using containers such as Docker, Kubernetes, ...  
-Federated Learning, Quantization, LoRa, ...  
-Experience with Cloud API Models invocation  
-Experience in deploying models (endpoint creation and management)  
-3D Lidar photogrammetry  
-Visual Odometry  
-Satellite imaging  
-Stream video processing  
-Experience in deploying models on edge devices or embedded systems  
-C++  


What will you be accountable for?  
Your responsibilities around our computer vision services will be focused on the following fields of action:        -Project execution: ensuring the achievement of technical milestones in terms of effectiveness, efficiency and customer satisfaction. Identifying resources needed to do so while ensuring proper management of time, risk and quality.  
-Train, adapt and finetune CV models to solve business problems.  
-Development of CI/CD pipelines leveraging model development industrialization.  
-Collaborate and support development teams to integrate the models in different systems.  
-Technical decision making.  


What do we offer?  
We propose:        -To work on projects for leading companies in the Spanish and European market.  
-To be involved in high priority projects with visibility to senior leadership  
-To apply the latest technical innovations in artificial intelligence platforms.  
-To join the team of a consolidated multinational such as NTT Data, which shares with you its professional interests and enjoys applying artificial intelligence in large companies and public agencies.  
-A competitive salary according to provided experience.  
-A career path that ensures your professional development and continuous improvement (language courses, management and professional skill training, technical training and certifications).  


If you are interested or would like to have more information, please apply via this advertisement.

jobs_data.title: Ingeniero/a de Integración y Pruebas
jobs_data.description:
CT es una empresa líder en tecnología, que proporciona servicios de innovación e ingeniería en los sectores aeronáutico, espacial, naval, automovilístico, ferroviario, energético y de plantas industriales. CT impulsa los límites de la tecnología a través de la innovación, y lleva la eficiencia a otro nivel cubriendo todo el ciclo de vida de los productos, desde el diseño y la fabricación hasta el soporte postventa. Con más de 30 años de experiencia, el éxito de CT está impulsado hoy en día por más de 1.800 ingenieros/ras expertos repartidos en siete países, en tres continentes.

Descripción del puesto: Buscamos un/a ingeniero/a con experiencia en integración y pruebas de software. Rol fundamental para asegurar la funcionalidad y calidad de sistemas software avanzados mediante actividades de validación y verificación.

Responsabilidades

      -Integración de componentes de software en un sistema unificado, asegurando su correcto funcionamiento.
-Diseño y ejecución de planes de pruebas: unitarias, de integración y de sistema.
-Análisis de resultados, documentación de informes y seguimiento de incidencias.
-Colaboración con equipos de desarrollo y validación para garantizar la calidad del software.
-Cumplir con los estándares técnicos y de calidad establecidos.



Qué Ofrecemos

Participación en proyectos técnicos desafiantes.

Formación continua y oportunidades de crecimiento profesional.

Un entorno dinámico y enfocado en la excelencia técnica.

      -Formación en Ingeniería de Software, Electrónica, Telecomunicaciones o similar.
-Experiencia en integración de software y diseño de casos de prueba.
-Conocimientos en herramientas de pruebas y automatización (p. ej., Jenkins, Selenium).
-Familiaridad con sistemas de control de versiones (GitLab, GitHub).
-Nivel avanzado de inglés.



Se Valorará

      -Certificaciones en pruebas de software (ISTQB) o experencia en QA testing
-Experiencia en metodologías ágiles.
-Conocimientos en normativas y estándares relacionados con software crítico.
-Experiencia previa en integración de sistemas complejos.

jobs_data.title: Programador/a senior .Net
jobs_data.description: Descripción ¿Te apasiona la tecnología? ¿Quieres desarrollarte en una empresa dinámica y en constantecrecimiento? ¡Te estamos buscando! En Nunsys Group estamos ampliando nuestro equipo,buscamos un/a Programador/a .NET MOM Senior, para incorporarse en nuestra sede de Aranda del Duero, Valencia o Sevilla. Nuestro viaje empezó en 2007 y tenemos una meta: ser la empresa española líder en tecnología.Nos apasiona la transformación digital y contamos con un gran portfolio de solucionestecnológicas. Gracias a esto garantizamos que podemos afrontar cualquier reto que nos planteennuestros clientes. Actualmente somos más de 2.600 profesionales y tenemos presencia en 25 ciudades españolas,Portugal, USA, Colombia y Ecuador. ¡Y esto es solo el principio! Y el proyecto ¿en qué consiste? El día a día es muy variado, pero algunas de las funciones en las que participarás son: -Participarás en proyectos nacionales e internacionales en empresas lideres del sector Food&Beverage como desarrollador de aplicaciones para soluciones MOM como LIMS , PDM y R&D. -Formarás parte de un equipo de alto conocimiento y se desarrollarás como profesional en la interpretación de necesidades de nuestros clientes y en aplicar las solucione necesarias para obtener los objetivos deseados para cada proyecto. -Las soluciones que desarrollarás tendrán aplicaciones en la formulación de nuevos productos, en la gestión de la calidad y los laboratorios de las empresas y en la gestion de proyectos globales. -Formarás parte de un equipo con metodología Agile y SCRUM. 🌟 ¿Qué estamos buscando? -Buscamos personas con una gran capacidad de organización y una metodología de trabajo impecable, en este equipo todos/as sumamos. -En Nunsys Group el compañerismo es esencial. Nos apoyamos mutuamente para superar cualquier desafío y alcanzar nuestros objetivos en equipo. -Tener experiencia en el desarrollo de aplicaciones informáticas con el framework .NET o similar -Tener experiencia en software MOM , en especial LIMS y SPEC al menos de 2 años. -Manejo de las estructuras básicas y funciones de bases de datos SQL. -Manejo de estructuras XML y JSON. -Tener grado superior como desarrollador de aplicaciones informáticas. Si tienes experiencia en el puesto y quieres formar parte de nuestro equipo ¡vamos por el buen camino! 🔝 ¿Algo más con lo que aportar valor? -Es necesario leer y entender Inglés para la documentación y las formaciones que se imparten por parte de nuestro proveedor de software. ¿Nos eliges? Con nosotros encontrarás:💼 Contrato indefinido en una empresa líder en el sector💰 Paquete retributivo competitivo acorde a los conocimientos y experiencia aportados🌴 Jornada intensiva los meses de julio y agosto y todos los viernes del año.📚En nuestro equipo creemos en las personas y en su talento, por eso apostamos por la formación de nuestros profesionales.💳Posibilidad de acogerte al programa de retribución flexible: Ticket Guardería, Ticket restaurante, Tarjeta transporte y Seguro Médico.🤑Descuentos en distintos establecimientos, productos (electrodomésticos, moda, tecnología) y servicios (viajes, alquiler de vehículos, salud).💗 Un ambiente diverso y sobre todo inclusivo donde lo primero son las personas.🎉 ¡No todo es trabajo, también hay tiempo para la diversión! Tenemos diferentes eventos a lo largo del año, desde nuestro "Christmas Jumper Day" hasta nuestro concurso de disfraces en Halloween, siempre buscamos formas de crear un ambiente divertido. ¡Y muchas más cosas que queremos que conozcas!¿Quieres unirte a nosotros/as y ser parte del cambio? Queremos informar a todo interesado/a en nuestras ofertas de empleo que las únicas ofertas vigentes están publicadas en nuestra página web https://empleo.nunsys.com/ o https://www.sothis.tech/unete-al-equipo/, no debiendo confiar en portales que simplemente se limitan a agregar la información de nuestras ofertas con objeto recabar sus datos personales.

jobs_data.title: Software Development Engineer in Test (Spain)
jobs_data.description: About Copado Copado is the #1 DevOps Platform for Salesforce and the Cloud. We harness the power of native CI/CD and Robotic Testing to drive digital transformation for 1,000+ of the most innovative brands on the planet — from Coca-Cola to eBay to Volkswagen. Our low-code platform unites non-technical admins and pro-code developers on the same system and empowers enterprises to scale end-to-end software delivery across multi-cloud environments. The impact on your business? 20X faster releases, 94% fewer production bugs and 46% more Salesforce ROI. The impact on your team? No more late nights, weekend war rooms or stressful release days. Brief Summary Of Role As Software Development Engineer in Test, you will work in the QA Automation team and collaborate with agile software squads. Our mission is to make release days obsolete and you will create a strong safety net against software regression by building automated test suites. You are good at finding bugs and you will also conduct Exploratory Testing of new features to catch the bugs before customers do. You take ownership over your own area and actively search for opportunities to improve quality and increase effectiveness by automating what can be automated. Your work makes the CI/CD pipelines quality-driven and has a big impact in terms of the reduction of bugs leaked to customers and speed of development. What You’ll Be Doing -Build both end-to-end user interface test automation, as well as API test automation with Robot Framework, Python, Copado Robotic Testing, and Copado Explorer -Integrate quality gates and tools to Continuous Integration and Delivery pipelines -Follow up the test results and quality metrics -Carry out Exploratory Testing to familiarize yourself with the new features and find bugs in them -Collaborate closely with your colleagues by reviewing their pull requests We Are Looking for Someone With -Robot Framework & Python as the key test automation technical skills -Testing skills and experience (typically from manual testing, ideally Exploratory Testing) -Quality mindset; proud of being a QA professional; takes responsibility over QA; “pulls work” (user stories to be tested), instead of expecting the manager to micromanage and tell what to do next -Working with CI/CD pipelines -Salesforce experience is a big plus -Improving own work, processes, and skills -Communicating well in written and spoken English to all directions Nice to Have -You are energetic and enjoy working in a fast-paced global environment -You love working in an agile environment and continuously strive for improvement -Want to be part of the growth of an early stage organization Copado is Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Copado does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Copado will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Copado.

jobs_data.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer – .Net (m/f/d)
jobs_data.description:
Hello. We are BestSecret. And we will tell you the secret.

We are Europe’s most exclusive closed fashion shopping community and are on our way to becoming the #1 online destination for off-price fashion in Europe. With our diverse team of more than 1,700 international fashion and technology enthusiasts from over 70 countries, we create an extraordinary online shopping experience.

Senior Backend Software Engineer – .Net (m/f/d)

Location:  remote, Spain; remote, Greece;

Your responsibilities

      -Develop and maintain APIs and endpoints to facilitate our AI-based strategy for email and chatbot automation within our customer service case management tool and on-site operations.
-Develop and maintain the backend of our innovative customer service center solution, utilizing a state-of-the-art technology stack.
-Collaborate closely with product teams, ensuring short release cycles while maintaining full ownership of the products to which you contribute.
-Collaborate with other teams within BestSecret, with a particular emphasis on the customer service team.
-Empower your team to pursue excellence and grow collectively with each challenge.
-Contribute to software design & architecture decisions to ensure that the solution is resilient, scalable, and fulfills our buyers' requirements.




About You

      -At least 5 Years of practical experience with .Net Core and good knowledge about event-driven architectures using Kafka and distributed systems.
-Experience with end-to-end development processes, including unit, integration & functional testing, deployment pipelines (GitLab), application tuning/profiling. Monitoring (ELK | Prometheus | Grafana | Datadog) is a plus.
-Familiarity with cloud infrastructures and container orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes.  
-Extensive knowledge of relational databases, with a preference for PostgreSQL and SQL Server.
-Experience in front-end development, preferably with Vue.js 3, is a plus.
-Proficiency in machine learning, analytics, data science, and data lakes (Starburst) is a plus.
-Demonstrated sense of ownership, independence, and a commitment to maintaining high quality, encompassing clean code, clean architecture, application design, and reliable software.
-Proficient in English, the primary working language across all teams.




Benefits

Become part of our success story and work in an innovative working environment

Individual training for your personal development

Find an environment where you feel comfortable and can develop fully

Great employee discounts for your perfect style

Stay fit and healthy with our corporate memberships at exclusive fitness and wellness clubs in Germany

Attractive salary package and 30 days of vacation

Highly motivated colleagues and a thorough induction phase

Hybrid working gives you a high degree of flexibility

At BestSecret, diversity isn't just a trend – it's our professional philosophy. We are dedicated to cultivating an inclusive workplace where everyone's unique talents and backgrounds are celebrated. Applicants from all backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are welcome to join us in our mission towards a more vibrant and inclusive future.

Best Secret GmbH

Jose Raul Ariza Navarro

jobs_data.title: Data & ML Engineer
jobs_data.description:
ClearPeaks is a specialist consulting firm delivering services and solutions in "Everything Data" - Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Big Data & Cloud, and Web & Mobile Applications. Founded in 2000, we have been a trusted partner to our customers in over 15 industry verticals and functional areas, with operations spanning Europe, Middle East, the United States, and Africa.
ClearPeaks is part of a strategic alliance with synvert, a group of six successful full-service Data & Analytics (D&A) consulting firms, with a clear goal to become one of EMEA's largest D&A consulting companies.
Our services are based on the latest market-leading enterprise technology platforms, and delivered by a dynamic team of expert consultants. Our strength lies in our ability to efficiently deliver customer insight and value, gained through our decades of experience with real-world challenges.
As a  Data Engineer  with a focus on machine learning integration, you will design, implement, and manage data pipelines in Dataiku, leveraging automation, testing, and monitoring best practices. Additionally, you’ll implement and embed machine learning models within data services, ensuring scalability, performance, and reliability through MLOps practices.  
At ClearPeaks, there are endless opportunities to get involved in different projects bringing innovative ideas while being part of leading-edge teams who are always innovating and evolving in the Data Management field.
Responsibilities
      -Design, implement, and maintain data pipelines in Dataiku with a focus on automation, monitoring, and testing.  
-Develop and integrate Python API services within Dataiku, following production-grade best practices.  
-Embed machine learning models into data services and optimize them for performance.  
-Perform model testing, evaluation, and continuous monitoring to ensure optimal model performance.  
-Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, analyse data needs, and provide solutions using Dataiku.  
-Actively participate in MLOps practices, from deployment to monitoring and model lifecycle management.  



Requirements
      -A degree in Computer Science or Telecommunication Engineering, Informatics, Statistics or related degree.
-Proven experience with Python and Jupyter notebooks for data engineering and machine learning tasks.  
-Familiarity with Dataiku and experience with implementing data pipelines in the platform.  
-Strong knowledge of general machine learning principles, including similarity search, recommendation engines, and supervised learning.  
-Ability to implement API services using libraries such as Pydantic and FastAPI.  
-Solid understanding of MLOps practices and model lifecycle management.  
-Familiarity with best practices in production code, object-oriented programming, and software architectures.  


Nice to have
      -Background in software development, particularly in API services.  
-Experience with large language models (LLMs) and frameworks like LangChain, with skills in function calling and structured output generation.  
-Knowledge of zero-shot classification and experience with recommendation engines.  
-Experience with cloud data platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.  



Our offer to you!
      -Work with leading edge technologies that will enable you to accelerate your career development.
-Enjoy an excellent work environment where people love what they do.
-Be part of an international and ambitious team whilst having fun.

YOU WILL -Implement new features to the existing project (PHP, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, MySql, Symfony, Vue) -Maintaining the web application (refactoring, improving performance, fixing issues, migrating code to new solutions) -Maintain and grow the web infrastructure over AWS (Debian, Terraform, Ansible) -Refactor the software to meet modern standards: SOLID, DDD, Hexagonal Architecture, Unit Test, Functional Test -Work on code optimization -Work in a cross-functional agile team THIS IS YOU -You have very good PHP knowledge. This includes programming, debugging, automation and testing. Experience in using a PHP MVC Framework is a must. -You know the PHPUnit framework. -You have at least 3 years of coding with PHP -You are familiar with modern coding standards: SOLID, DDD, Hexagonal Architecture, Unit Test, Functional Test -You are very familiar with HTML5 and CSS3, can build responsive designs using Flexbox and understand the basics of Javascript (jQuery). -Knowledge of SASS/LESS is a plus. -Knowledge of AWS/DevOps culture is a plus. -You have at least basic knowledge about one of the modern Javascript Frameworks (React/Angular/Vue etc) and ES6. -You have good MySQL knowledge (designing optimal database structure and constructing advanced queries, aware of slow queries). -You understand REST APIs. -You have a basic level of Linux administration skills and can work in the Linux environment in your day-to-day work. -You are passionate about programming and new development standards. -You're a go-getter with initiative, and you thrive on taking ownership of your tasks! -You have a good level of English. -You have at least experience with Laravel or Symfony. WHAT DO WE OFFER -Competitive salary -Flexibility in schedule - short Fridays & work-from-home options up to 50% -15 days of remote work days from countries within the EU -25 days of holiday a year, and an additional day for seniority after 3 years in the company -Half a day off to celebrate your birthday -Discounted Private Health Insurance -Discounted membership with Urban Sports Club -Central Barcelona office location -Dog-friendly office -Fresh fruit, drinks and loads of snacks -Social events such as our rooftop BBQs and seasonal parties -Fantastic colleagues from all over the world -Referral bonus Got something to bring to The Box? jobs_data.title: Machine Learning Engineer
jobs_data.description: Overview Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Learn more about what we do. Our powerful, award-winning culture embraces a bold vision of where technology can take us and a passion for tackling challenging problems with industry-first solutions. Diversity, equity & inclusion are integral parts of our culture and drivers of innovation at Keysight. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. About The Team: Join Keysight's central AI team in Barcelona, a newly formed division dedicated to innovation and excellence in machine learning. As we build this new team from the ground up, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the future of our AI initiatives and make a significant impact from day one. Our team is a hub of innovation where top-tier researchers and engineers collaborate to create cutting-edge ML technologies that power our world-class products and services. We are at the forefront of AI research, driving advancements in supervised and unsupervised learning, generative models, temporal learning, multimodal input streams, deep reinforcement learning, inverse reinforcement learning, and large language models. At Keysight, we are passionate about pushing the boundaries of what is possible. Our mission is to develop transformative ML solutions that address real-world, large-scale problems, ensuring our products lead the industry in performance and reliability. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on pioneering projects, develop state-of-the-art algorithms, and contribute to the evolution of technologies that enable the next generation of design and test products, including those for the 6G era. We foster a dynamic and collaborative environment where innovation thrives, and every team member's contribution is valued. Our cross-functional teams work closely to integrate AI/ML solutions seamlessly into our products, ensuring that we meet and exceed the needs of our customers. If you are driven by curiosity, inspired by challenges, and ready to make a significant impact, Keysight's central AI team is the place for you. Responsibilities About the Role: We are seeking highly qualified individuals to join our newly build AI-team as Machine Learning Engineers. Specifically, we are looking for people with expertise in 3 areas: - Transformers, Generative AI, Large Language Models. - Machine Learning/ Deep Learning i the field of Telecommunications and Networking. - Pytorch experts with experience with model optimization techniques and training parallelism paradigms. We are dedicated to research and development in the field of machine learning within the design and test industry. As part of the team, you will have the opportunity to be the first to work on some of the most challenging technical problems and develop innovative ML solutions that will influence the future of Keysight’s products and business operations. You'll be developing innovative ML solutions for our next-generation design and test products, enabling 6G. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams across Keysight to ensure that the AI/ML solutions are seamlessly integrated within our products. We're looking for someone who is self-motivated, thrives in dynamic environments, quickly builds relationships, and adapts to change and ambiguity. Strong programming skills and experience crafting, prototyping, and delivering sophisticated algorithmic solutions are essential. Responsibilities: -Work with large datasets; extract and manipulate data using tools such as Spark SQL, command line, and scripting languages. -Design, develop, validate, and maintain predictive models and pipelines using the latest machine learning technologies. -Implement and deploy machine learning models to improve business metrics. -Develop tools to enhance the development, deployment, and lifecycle of machine learning models. -Collaborate with stakeholders, including customers and internal teams, to ensure alignment and success. -Understand and prioritize customer needs, conveying this urgency to product development teams. -Inspire and challenge development teams to achieve high performance sustainably. Qualifications Required Qualifications: -Master’s degree with 1-3 years of experience or PhD degree -In-depth knowledge of deep learning (DL) and statistical machine learning (ML) -Strong understanding of predictive modeling and machine learning algorithms (supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, regression, clustering, CNN/RNN/LSTM/Transformer, etc.) -Proficiency in programming with Python and C++ -Hands-on experience with TensorFlow or PyTorch Desired Qualifications: -Experience with the complete MLOps workflow, including data platforms, training infrastructure, and edge deployment -Passion for developing intuitive, maintainable, and well-documented software tools/apps -Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, meet tight deadlines, and independently explore new ideas to improve Keysight products and operations -Creative and collaborative mindset -Strong verbal and written communication skills What We Offer: A place within an exciting company! At Keysight we develop with our visionary, market-leading, and highly innovative customers breakthroughs that connect and secure the world. We offer you a highly competitive package. See our culture and our Benefits. At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - Youtube.

jobs_data.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs_data.description: TomTom is a global leader in navigation, mapping, and traffic information. Join our dynamic team and vibrant culture to contribute to shaping the future of location technology. We seek a strong Software Engineer IV to join our Locations Platform organization and be a key part of the team. In this role, you will be crucial in building TomTom’s Android and IOS Navigation SDK. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline and optimize the software development lifecycle, ensuring efficient and reliable builds for our cutting-edge location-based products. What You'll Do -Design, develop, and maintain high-quality software solutions to support the software development lifecycle. -Collaborate with internal teams to understand their workflow, pain points and identify opportunities to improve our services. -Implement and optimize build pipelines, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance. -Troubleshoot and resolve issues, providing timely support to development teams. -Stay current with industry best practices and tools, continuous integration, and delivery. -Contribute to the entire software development life cycle, including requirements gathering, design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance. -Mentor and guide junior engineers, providing technical expertise and fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement. What You'll Need -Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. -Proven track record of designing and delivering solutions for large-scale applications. -Strong proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Shell, or similar. -Strong proficiency in one or more high-level programming languages such as C++, Java, Python, or similar languages. -Solid understanding of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices for creating maintainable and scalable software systems. -Experience with CI/CD and build tools. -Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment. -Knowledge of version control systems, preferably Git. -Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues. -Familiarity with cloud service providers (e.g, Azure, AWS, GCP). -3+ years of Software Engineering experience. What We Offer A competitive compensation package, of course. Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning. Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities. Work flexibility, where TomTom’ers, in agreement with their manager and team, use both the office and home to focus, collaborate, learn and socialize. It’s all about getting the best out of both worlds – we ask TomTom’ers to come to the office two days a week, and the remaining three are free to be worked in either location. Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance. Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping. Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday. Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world. Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom! Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location. Meet your team We're the Navigation SDK team. We work on complex code to develop TomTom's Navigation Software Development Kit, integrating technologies provided by other Product Units and enabling our customers to easily build competitive navigation applications. Your code will also be at the heart of TomTom's navigation products like AmiGO, helping millions of people find their way in the world. At TomTom... You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet. Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them. After you apply Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs . TomTom is an equal opportunity employer TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.

jobs_data.title: Data Engineer
jobs_data.description:
¿Tu pasión es la  analítica de datos? Si quieres formar parte de proyectos internacionales... Sigue leyendo.

      -Lo que te ofrecemos*
-  Flexibilidad Total: Organiza tu día como prefieras, ¡tu tiempo es tuyo!  
-  Trabajo Híbrido (3 días presencial): Con nuestros Blue Days , disfruta de 4 semanas al año trabajando desde cualquier parte de España.  
-  Crecimiento Versátil: Aprende nuevos idiomas y explora diversos sectores con nuestra Expleo Academy.  
-  Tiempo para Ti: Disfruta de 24 días de vacaciones al año, más los días 24 y 31 de diciembre.  
-  Ambiente Inmejorable: Un lugar donde el apoyo entre compañeros es la norma y la competitividad no tiene cabida.  
-  Conexión y Bienestar: En Expleo nunca faltan la risas, y la diversión está asegurada. Disfruta de nuestro club de pádel y running a la vez que haces piña con tus compañeros. También tenemos evento de verano, Halloween y mucho más.  
-  Beneficios Flexibles: Seguro médico, cheques restaurante y guardería, ¡tú eliges cómo usarlos!  
-¿Qué te hará triunfar en esta posición?*
-  Sólido entendimiento de Arquitectura de Datos / Modelado de Datos.  
-  Programación en Python para Datos (enfoque funcional).  
-  Experiencia en bases de datos relacionales / SQL.  
-  Experiencia previa con APIs REST (para pipelines de datos / ETL).  
-  Experiencia previa con APIs SOAP (para pipelines de datos / ETL).  
-  Conocimiento de Git y CI/CD (enfoque de múltiples ramas).  
-  Más de 5 años trabajando en Ingeniería de Datos.  
-  Experiencia en proyectos de datos en los ámbitos de Contabilidad, Gestión del Rendimiento Financiero, y Planificación y Análisis Financiero.  
-  Fluidez en inglés.  
-  Se valora:
      -  Experiencia con DBT.  
-  Experiencia con Spark.  
-  Experiencia con tecnologías de transmisión de datos.  

-Tu misión en el puesto*
-  Refinarás / visualizarás soluciones técnicas para abordar los requisitos comerciales a la luz de los estándares y marcos de datos del cliente.  
-  Implementarás pipelines de datos / procesos de datos / APIs dentro del stack técnico de la plataforma de datos.  
-  Serás responsable de la prueba del entorno de desarrollo proporcionando la evidencia básica de los resultados.  
-  Apoyarás a los ingenieros de aseguramiento de calidad (QA) durante la fase de prueba de integración del sistema (SIT) en el entorno de pruebas y serás responsable del despliegue en producción.  
-  Apoyarás al equipo en la resolución de problemas del entorno de producción con los pipelines de datos / APIs REST existentes.  
-  Serás el principal responsable del esfuerzo de documentación de las soluciones técnicas implementadas (a nivel de User Story / nivel de Catálogo de Datos).  


¿Listo/a para ser parte de algo grande? Si quieres que la posición sea tuya,  inscríbete ahora a la oferta  . ¡Tu próxima aventura te espera aquí, no te la pierdas.

“Somos una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y aceptamos solicitudes de todas las personas debidamente calificadas, independientemente de su raza, sexo, discapacidad, religión/creencia, orientación sexual o edad”

jobs_data.title: Senior Software Engineer - Avionics and Flight System
jobs_data.description:
Sener is currently looking for Senior Software Engineers to join our Avionics and Flight System Division at our Tres Cantos work center (Madrid) or Cerdanyola del Vallès (Barcelona).

We are a pioneering engineering company in the design of satellite technology and equipment for space exploration. In defence, we design and produce equipment and systems, including unmanned systems. Our passion for precision has made us a trusted partner of leading space agencies, government agencies and companies.

What you will do:

      -Definition of SW solutions: architectures, SW components, IFs, requirements…
-Preparation of SW specifications for SW components development.
-Understanding HW/FW platform and being able to define SW/HW, SW/FW Ifs.
-Break down the defined solution into affordable SW component and tasks, according to project context: schedule, profiles, platform…
-Implementation and testing of critical SW functions.
-Skilled on SW debugging.
-Be able to guide and coordinate small SW engineers team.
-Be able to lead make/buy trade offs.
-Participate in proposals preparation.



What we expect from you:

      -Engineering Degree.
-8 years background in SW development areas (RT Embedded SW and High Level SW solutions, space, defence or automotive markets preferred).
-Experience in all stages of SW lifecycle: requirements & spec, architecture definition, SW implementation, validation, integration.
-Experience in defining SW architectures, layers, components, Ifs…  
-Be able to gather and analytically understand user requirements, providing guideless for the solution not only focusing on SW but as well, HW/FW approaches (being able to understands requirements to HW resources).
-Ability to communicate technical approaches and details within small project teams, including team interactions and presentations.
-Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to clearly articulate customer technical needs into technical specifications.
-Experience in agile methodologies.
-Experience with continuous Integration tools.
-High level of English.



We also value:  

      -Use of Linux-based operating systems.
-Expertise in Simulink and Matlab.
-Strong background on C, and C coding practices.
-Knowledge on state of the art on OS and Hypervisors.
-Open-minded character with a vision of the solution and to focus on each individual component.
-For High Level SW:
      -Strong background on C#
-Knowledge on data structures and process  
-Experience with relational databases (preferable PostgreSQL)
-Knowledge of containerization techniques (Docker, Kubernetes)
-Able to manage TCP & UDP and socket programming  

-Excellent team-working
-Proactive and innovation driven character



What we offer:

These are some of the benefits you will enjoy at Sener:

      -Join a multidisciplinary and highly qualified team participating in technologically innovative projects at an international level.
-Continue your professional development with us and access a wide range of training (technical training, skills, languages ...).
-Take care of yourself with our physical and emotional well-being program: sports, workshops, medical service, physiotherapy ...
-Optimize your salary with our flexible remuneration plan (meal card, private health insurance, daycare tickets, etc.) and have our life and accident insurance.
-Make the way you work more flexible! We have flexible hours, teleworking policy, coworking spaces...
-Discount portal for you and specific onboarding for our international employees.
-We promote equal opportunities, diversity and inclusion of all people and we are certified as a Entidad Familiarmente responsable - efr. And from the Sener Foundation we collaborate in activities that promote the search for knowledge and contribute to the socially responsible development of engineering.



If you feel identified, we will wait for you… at Sener we want to go as far as you want to go!

jobs_data.title: AWS DevOps Engineer
jobs_data.description:
One of the companies with which we collaborate in Joppy, one of the top 3 banks in Spain, is looking for a Architecture & Operations - DevOps (AWS) to join their team in Madrid (hybrid work model).
➡️ The roleDevOps engineers implement changes to the AWS platform in an automated fashion using infrastructure-as-code (<span class="tvm-operation__underline">IaC) and configuration management technology. They deploy new services and update and complete fixes in the production environment.You will have the opportunity to work with a dynamic and independent team of engineers and other areas such as Architecture, QA, Product Management and Delivery to design and develop advanced capabilities.🎯 Tasks      -Creating cloud-based infrastructure required by the software team in  AWS.
-Creating and maintaining scripts to activate and deactivate instances on demand.
-Maintaining security compliances like passwords, key rotation policies.
-Providing direct support during various operations such as deployment and general production.
-Collaborating with developers to ensure that new environments meet requirements and conform to best practices.
-Define several types of alerts (OpsGenie alerts) that monitor system’s health and report any issues if they occur and when they do, the DevOps team takes ownership of the issues and resolves them themselves or at least escalates them to the proper team.
-Cost savings / cost optimisation is a huge part of their activities.


🛠️ Requirements      -Strong background in system automation and Linux administration.
-Experience of three-layers architectures: web (Apache), engine (tomcat/spring) and database (MySQL, PostgreSQL, ORACLE, and NoSQL databases).
-Experience in source code tools, continuous integration tools and team management tools.
-Understanding of cloud computing concepts and design considerations using modern patterns such as infrastructure as code or ephemeral servers.
-Experience of monitoring frameworks (such as CloudWatch, Splunk, Grafana, or similar).
-Expertise in container technologies including ECS, EKS, Fargate, Docker, or Kubernetes.
-Knowledge of configuration management systems, such as Ansible, or related systems

jobs_data.title: AI Software Developer
jobs_data.description:
Location:

Valls, T, ES, 43800 Coventry, GB, CV6 5TP

Country/Region: United Kingdom

Job Function: Information Technology

Requisition ID: 37663

Employment Type: Salary

Company Overview

Lear, a global automotive technology leader in Seating and E-Systems, enables superior in-vehicle experiences for consumers around the world. Lear’s diverse team of talented employees in 37 countries is driven by a commitment to innovation, operational excellence, and sustainability. Lear is Making every drive better™ by providing the technology for safer, smarter, and more comfortable journeys. Lear, headquartered in Southfield, Michigan, serves every major automaker in the world and ranks 189 on the Fortune 500. Further information about Lear is available at lear.com or on Twitter @LearCorporation.

Position Overview

As an AI-focused software developer, you’ll be responsible for designing, implementing, and deploying machine learning models and algorithms into production systems. Your role will involve creating custom solutions, integrating AI capabilities into existing software applications, and ensuring reliable performance. You’ll collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and domain experts to address real-world challenges across various domains, such as natural language processing, recommendation systems, and computer vision.

Main Missions

      -  Collaborate with data scientists, product managers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements.  
-  Translate theoretical AI algorithms into robust, scalable code.  
-  Develop and optimize machine and deep learning models.  
-  Test and debug AI software to ensure functionality and reliability.  
-  AI deployment in industrial plants.  



Health, Safety & Environmental Responsibilities

      -  Ensure a safe working environment by following and supporting the Company’s working practices,  
-  comply with all relevant HSE legislation and local policies and procedures – Additional Responsibilities detailed in the HS&E Manual.  
-  Ensure peers and members in the department comply with TS16949 policies and procedures.  



Key Skills And Qualifications

      -  Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.  
-  Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., Python, C#, C++).  
-  Experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).  
-  Knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g.,Azure)  
-  Familiarity with containerization is a plus (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).  
-  Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).  
-  Knowledge of data lifecycle management.  
-  Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.  
-  Ability to work in an agile development environment.  
-  Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.  
-  Passion for staying up to date with AI trends and advancements.  



  Why Lear  

We offer a fantastic place to work that embraces diversity, opportunities for growth and the chance to be part of a company that puts its people first.

What We Offer

      -  Competitive Salary,  
-  Access to Learning and development opportunities.  
-  Opportunities to give back to the community.  
-  Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world  



Lear Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse workplace.

Applicants must submit their resumes for consideration using our applicant tracking system. Due to the high volume of applications received, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies, or similar, will not be paid a fee and will become the property of Lear Corporation.
