jobs_data.title: UI Developer
jobs_data.description:
Lo que buscamos es…Una persona con entre 2 y 4 años de experiencia en maquetación web, con una alta sensibilidad en el diseño visual, para unirse a nuestro equipo de desarrollo en Madrid.
Para eso, necesitamos que tengas experiencia en…      -En maquetación web de componentes visuales bajo HTML, CSS y JavaScript (Estándares W3C).
-Trabajando con preprocesadores CSS, como SASS (.scss)
-Con metodologías de estilo, como BEM.
-En accesibilidad web WCAG 2.1 - 2.2 (AA)
-En desarrollo Responsive multinavegador y multidispositivo.
-Desarrollando componentes UI para librerías y frameworks como
-LitElement, Vue, Angular, React, etc.
-Sensibilidad con el diseño para viabilizar y refinar entregables realizados por el equipo de diseñadores.
-Con herramientas de diseño como Figma o Sketch (no es necesario nivel experto) para entender los sistemas de diseño.
-Trabajando en proyectos bajo metodologías Agile Scrum.


Y sería genial que también supieras…      -Supieras trabajar con motores de plantillas, como Pug.
-Tuvieras experiencia testando interfaces a través de lectores de pantalla.
-Realizaras test unitarios con frameworks como Jest o Mocha.
-Desarrollases bajo frameworks SPA como Vue, Angular o React.


En Garaje nos gustan las personas que...Se enorgullecen de su trabajo, dan lo mejor de sí mismas, se divierten siempre, son valientes y se arriesgan, aprenden de los errores y aman lo que hacen.Nuestra actitud se define por la pasión con la que nos involucramos en nuestros proyectos, la empatía y cercanía que mostramos hacia nuestros clientes, y nuestra ambición de ir más allá de lo correcto.
En Garaje...Somos | No somos:➔ Somos humildes y cercanos [pero no serviles ni simplistas]➔ Somos apasionados y expertos [pero no abrumadores ni pretenciosos]➔ Somos makers con propósito [pero no meros hacedores o gurús]➔ Somos valientes y consecuentes [pero no insensatos o irresponsables]➔ Somos autoexigentes [pero no bloqueantes]
Y las ventajas con las que contarás son:      -Contrato indefinido:  Queremos que te sientas parte de Garaje y que puedas crecer con nosotros a largo plazo.
-Flexibilidad horaria:  Tenemos horario flexible para que puedas adaptar tu jornada laboral a tu vida personal. Puedes ajustar tanto tu hora de entrada como de salida según las dinámicas y necesidades de conciliación, equipo y proyecto. Y en verano podrás disfrutar de  jornada intensiva.
-Actualmente, tenemos  dos días al mes  programados por la compañía (10% del total) en los que debes venir a las oficinas de Garaje. Esto lo hacemos para garantizar que todo el mundo tenga contacto con los demás más allá de una pantalla de vez en cuando.
-Seguro médico con Adeslas:  Accede al seguro de Garaje con beneficios fiscales. Además, puedes incluir a tu pareja e hijos. Sin copagos, carencias ni cuestionarios.
-Retribución flexible:  Ahorra en IRPF dedicando parte de tu salario a ticket restaurante, transporte y guardería.
-26 días de descanso:  Descansa con 23 días de vacaciones y festivos regionales. Además, te concedemos 2 días adicionales libres en Navidad y en tu cumpleaños para celebrar momentos especiales.
-Incentivos:  Trae nuevos clientes o empleados a Garaje y te pagamos por ello. ¡Sé parte del crecimiento!
-Cultura de la transparencia:  Creemos en la comunicación abierta y compartimos periódicamente la situación y objetivos de la compañía en nuestros All Hands, newsletter..
-G-Book: Nuestro oráculo.  En Garaje, tenemos una guía en Notion que resuelve todo tipo de dudas. Allí, puedes encontrar respuestas a preguntas que van desde cómo solicitar días libres y conocer quién es quién, hasta cómo preparar una guía de prueba, plantillas corporativas para entregables o presentaciones de proyectos similares como referencia... ¡No te sentirás perdido!
-Eventos y dinámicas frecuentes:  Compartimos conocimiento y aprendizajes de los proyectos constantemente. Como nos gusta pasar tiempo juntos, también organizamos eventos informales para conocernos mejor y divertirnos como equipo.
-Bono de 500€:  Incentivamos tu desarrollo profesional con un bono de 500€ para que inviertas en formación, aprendizaje de idiomas, libros o eventos del sector.
-Entorno de alto crecimiento:  Evoluciona tu carrera en Garaje y trabaja en equipos multidisciplinarios de Diseño, Data, Growth y Tecnología, creando experiencias, servicios y productos con impacto para grandes clientes como Vodafone, BBVA, Endesa, Banco Santander, Inditex, Telefónica, Adeslas, Repsol, IKEA, Legálitas, RBI y Grupo Dani García. Ser parte del equipo de Garaje significa tener la oportunidad de contribuir a la creación de experiencias, servicios y productos con un impacto significativo.
-Trabajarás junto a especialistas en todas las disciplinas tecnológicas (Arquitectura, Front, Back, Mobile, Ecommerce...) y ofreciendo un servicio personalizado adaptado a las necesidades y situaciones existentes de nuestros clientes.


¿Qué pasará ahora?Si te suena bien, haz click en “solicitar”, ¡estamos esperando tu candidatura con ganas!Si tu perfil encaja con lo que estamos buscando, nos pondremos en contacto contigo pronto para coordinar una primera llamada telefónica de acercamiento.

jobs_data.title: Senior Data Scientist
jobs_data.description: En Keepler queremos hacer crecer nuestro equipo con personas que tengan ganas de desarrollar software basado en datos con dos objetivos: ayudar en la transformación a nuestros clientes y disfrutar del proceso de crear valor a través de la tecnología. Si quieres ser parte de un equipo que te ofrecerá retos tecnológicos y que te exigirá una mejora y aprendizaje continuo, si no tienes miedo a reconocer errores y eres capaz de ser proactivo/a y tirar del carro cuando te toque, es posible que Keepler sea el sitio donde deberías trabajar. ¿Te interesa? Echa un vistazo a nuestra vacante de Senior Data Scientist. Requisitos: -5+ años de entrenamiento, ajuste y despliegue de modelos de Machine Learning. -Experiencia en análisis exploratorio de datos. -Experiencia con Python y SQL. -Capacidad de pensamiento creativo, crítico y de investigación. -Experiencia en trato directo con cliente y facilidad de comunicación. -Experiencia en ecosistemas cloud: AWS, Azure y/o GCP. -Experiencia en áreas de NLU, Deep Learning, Sistemas de recomendación u Optimización. -Inglés alto, nivel B2-C1. Deseable: -Experiencia o interés en IA Generativa y proyectos de NLP. -Experiencia en el uso de modelos de lenguaje (LLM). -Experiencia y entusiasmo por trabajar con metodologías ágiles (Scrum, Kanban…). ¿Qué te ofrecemos en Keepler? -Un buen ambiente de trabajo junto a compañeros/as que son unos cracks en sus tecnologías y de quienes aprenderás cada día. -Tendrás un presupuesto personal anual de 2.000 euros para que lo dediques a formación y certificaciones. -Teletrabajo con asistencia flexible a la oficina. Nuestra oficina está situada en el centro de Madrid, lo que permite disfrutar de la ciudad en un entorno inmejorable y bien comunicado. -Ayuda económica mensual para consumibles del hogar derivados del teletrabajo. -Horario flexible de entrada y salida y flexibilidad en el almuerzo, para que tu vida personal y profesional encajen sin problema. -Jornada intensiva los viernes todo el año y los meses de julio y agosto. -Ayuda alimentaria de 11 euros al día que podrás recibir en ticket restaurante o en nómina, a tu elección. -Retribución flexible para tarjeta transporte, cheque guardería y seguro médico para familiares. -Formación inglés one-to-one gratis para ti, con 8 sesiones al mes en modalidad online. -Seguro médico privado con una amplia cobertura además de seguro dental y ventajas y precio reducido para tus familiares. -Salario competitivo basado en la meritocracia que reflejará tu crecimiento profesional y podrás hacerlo crecer añadiendo skills a tu perfil. ¿Qué significa? Te lo explicamos en este artículo: http://bit.ly/2rlIVUQ -Tu evaluación y subida salarial la realizarán tus compañeros/as, nada de responsables porque aquí no lo encontrarás como tal, y tienes 2 oportunidades al año para presentarte a una subida. -Una compañía con una cultura muy colaborativa que siempre piensa en hacerte la vida profesional más fácil para que solo te preocupes en hacer bien lo que te gusta. -Tendrás acompañamiento de un buddy los primeros meses para que te ayude en la adaptación. -Un ambiente solidario y transparente donde tus decisiones afectan a todos/as en la que prima la solidaridad contigo y con el que está a tu lado. Así entendemos Keepler, ¿te animas a trabajar con nosotros/as? -We believe en el talento apasionado por la tecnología. -We want personas con diferentes cualidades, mentes inquietas y deseo de aprender, explorar e implementar nuevas tecnologías que aporten valor a cada proyecto. -We invest en el desarrollo continuo de nuestros profesionales. -We foster una cultura de equipo y generosidad. Salario: El salario que te ofrecemos responde a una fórmula que tiene en cuenta tu perfil y ciertos skills claves para la compañía. Para estos perfiles, el rango salarial depende de tu experiencia y es 47k-56k euros al año con la posibilidad de complementarlo sin límite con skills. Por cada skill validado se cobra adicionalmente hasta 10k euros al año. Los skills valorados son: experiencia en Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Kanban, Machine Learning, Machine Learning Engineering, NLU, Computer Vision y Search & Optimization. Más información sobre su funcionamiento en nuestra web: https://keepler.io/salary-calculator

jobs_data.title: Desarrollador/a Python y SQL
jobs_data.description: Porque trabajar en Sopra Steria, también es sentir Sopra Steria.Somos un reconocido líder europeo en consultoría, servicios digitales y desarrollo de software, con cerca de 56.000 empleados en casi 30 países y más de 4.000 en España.Nos enfocamos en las personas, en su formación y desarrollo profesional, lo que nos impulsa a crecer y mejorar constantemente.Tenemos pasión por lo digital y al igual que tú, buscamos la mejor de las aventuras. Queremos que tu día a día se convierta en la mejor de tus inspiraciones. Que aprendas, aportes, te diviertas, crezcas y que, sobre todo, disfrutes al máximo.Si quieres formar parte de un equipo “Great Place to Work”, ¡Sigue leyendo! ¿Qué reto proponemos? Nos gustaría incorporar a dos personas dedicadas al mundo de la programación con Python, para trabajar en importante cliente bancario internacional ubicado en Madrid capital. El modelo de teletrabajo será híbrido alterno, siendo un mes 100% remoto y otro mes con 2-3 días en oficina por semana. Horario flexible de oficina con jornada intensiva en verano. ¿Qué buscamos? -Experiencia de al menos 2 años desarrollando con Python -Experiencia con SQL, incluyendo consultas SQL avanzadas para el análisis y diagnóstico de problemas. -Powershell para scripting y automatización de tareas -Nivel inglés B2, proyecto internacional con algunas interacciones en dicho idioma. Información adicional¿Qué tenemos para ti? -Contrato indefinido y jornada completa -23 días de vacaciones -Formación continua: competencias técnicas, transversales y de idiomas. Contamos con acceso a certificaciones, formaciones de los principales Partners Tecnológicos, plataformas online y ¡mucho más! -Seguro de vida y de accidentes -Posibilidad de acogerte a nuestra retribución flexible (seguro médico, cheques guarderías, transporte, comida y formación) -Acceso a Privilege Club, donde encontrarás descuentos interesantes en las principales marcas -Onboarding personalizado y detallado. Te acompañamos en todo momento para que te sientas #soprano desde el primer momento. -Oficina con espacios reservados al ocio. ¡Trabajo y diversión unido! -Compañerismo y buen ambiente, el poder de la unión lo tenemos presente. Y lo más importante…Tienes la posibilidad de desarrollar tu carrera profesional con nosotros: Crearemos juntos un plan de carrera personalizado. Te formarás, marcaremos objetivos y llevaremos a cabo un seguimiento para asegurarnos de que lo conseguimos juntos. Escuchamos tus prioridades y luchamos por ellas.¡Aquí tu voz importa! ¡Únete a nosotros y sé parte de algo más! The world is how we shape it Adquirimos el compromiso de respetar la diversidad, creando un ambiente de trabajo inclusivo y aplicando políticas que favorezcan la inclusión y promuevan el respeto social y cultural en cuestiones de género, edad, funcional, orientación sexual y religión con igualdad de oportunidades.

jobs_data.title: Data Software Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Desde LHH nos encontramos en búsqueda de dos Data Engineers para uno de nuestro clientes más importantes:
Área:  DataUbicación: Barcelona/MadridEmpresa:  cliente final del sector Financiero
Descripción de la oferta
Buscamos personas  curiosas  y  comprometidas. Personas que buscan  crecer, pero, sobre todo,  mejorar  el entorno de los empleados de nuestro cliente. ¿Eres una de ellas? Entonces, ¡esta oferta es para ti!
¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?Damos servicio a todas las áreas mediante una infraestructura de autoservicio que permite utilizar recursos y herramientas de analítica del dato para tomar decisiones estratégicas y dar mayor certeza en sus planes de acción.Nos encargamos de dar soporte, entender las necesidades del negocio y darles la mejor solución con la implantación de soluciones escalables dentro del ámbito de Data.A nivel entidad, estamos embarcados en el camino hacia el Cloud que llevará el entorno de datos corporativo y el desarrollo de los casos de uso analíticos a nuevas plataformas y paradigmas.Con nosotros podrás realizar proyectos con las tecnologías más punteras en el ámbito de la Analítica Avanzada y del Dato en general.Todo ello dentro de un equipo multidisciplinar y orientado a metodología de trabajo agile.
Cómo será tu día a día…      -Programación y desarrollo de herramientas y aplicaciones para la futura plataforma analítica del grupo.
-Participar en el diseño de soluciones y colaborar en la implantación en un entorno multidisciplinar
-Documentar el trabajo utilizando estándares, métodos y herramientas adecuadas.
-Realizar revisiones de código para el fomento de buenas prácticas de desarrollo.
-Desarrollo integral de software comprendiendo todo el ciclo de vida: revisión de requerimientos, análisis de la solución, programación y pruebas, revisión del incidental y evolución


Requisitos y competencias clave:      -Formación/Titulación: Ingeniería Informática/Telecomunicaciones. Matemáticas, Física o equivalentes.
-Experiencia demostrable en programación orientada a backends en Python y/o Java (preferiblemente ambas).
-Experiencia con integración a BBDD (BigQuery, Cloud SQL, BigTable, Oracle, etc.) y sistemas de cloud storage (GCS, S3, etc). Se valorará también conocimientos de BBDD NoSQL (Elastic, MongoDB).
-Conocimiento en plataformas de integración, gestor de colas y tiempo real (Kafka, Pub/Sub, Kinesis, Flink, Spark Streaming, Apache Beam, etc.).
-Conocimientos y experiencia en entornos cloud (preferiblemente GCP).
-Experiencia práctica en el uso de técnicas, metodologías para el control de versiones.
-Experiencia en colaboración con proyecto de implementación/evolución de arquitecturas Big Data y/o de IA.
-Preferible haber trabajado con metodologías ágiles (Scrum, Kanban o similares) y herramientas de gestión (Clarity PPM, Confluence, Jira…).



Si te apasiona…  
El mundo del dato y todo lo que supone la construcción de software y modelos de explotación a su alrededor, estás en el sitio adecuado ya que estamos en el proceso de construcción de la nueva plataforma informacional y analítica en Cloud.
Link oferta Madrid: https://caixabanktech.talentclue.com/es/job/110553843?public=1Link oferta Barcelona: https://caixabanktech.talentclue.com/es/job/110553979?public=1

jobs_data.title: Full Stack Software Engineer - Frontend Focus
jobs_data.description:
At Beyond, we power the business of Short Term Rentals through our cutting-edge, full-stack Revenue Management System. Venture-backed, we pioneered this space and have grown to be the globally dominant leader - obsessed with delivering value and performance to our customers. And the way we've been able to achieve those heights is our belief that People are the most important part of any business - starting with ours. We employ over 170 Beyonders across the globe who share in our commitment to making Beyond the best place to work.
As a Fullstack Engineer with Beyond, you will have the opportunity to build the next evolution of our SaaS-based product as well as work on new products. Because you will be working with a successful team that is completely remote, excellent coding and communication skills are key. This is a great opportunity for someone to work closely with the entire product life cycle from concept to go-to-market! If you enjoy rolling up your sleeves and jumping in, then read on!
Before reading further...Beyond is passionate about diversity and cultivating our team’s potential. If you’re hungry for a good opportunity, but don't meet every point in this job description, please apply anyway!
Our team believes in:      -Reducing scope  - The best way to control progress and test hypotheses is to prevent scope creep;
-Shipping early  - The best way to learn early is to ship early. No need to be perfect;
-Iterating and improving  - Once we get the feedback we need, we iterate and improve;
-Taking ownership  - The code we ship is our responsibility as we know it best;
-Delivering value  - By focussing on providing the best customer experience, we improve acquisition and retention and drive revenue.


As our  Full Stack Software Engineer, you'll be responsible for:      -Collaborating with your peers from product, design, and engineering on a cross-functional, outcome-based team to craft and deliver on OKRs
-Helping drive your team through large projects autonomously, while continuously assessing and communicating progress and iterating on solutions.
-Collaborating and recommending architectural solutions, while understanding and explaining trade-offs around time to market, structural and functional quality, security, maintainability, resources, and scope.
-Supporting and maintaining the existing code baseline and products.
-Exercising and improving Beyond’s engineering practices such as refactoring, pairing, code reviews, collective code ownership, containers, IaC, CI/CD, observability.


So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? The person who will be successful in this role will be:      -Curious  - You are driven to understand how things work or why they don't. You are interested in finding out how your work impacts our customers and the world they live in.
-Collaborative  - You enjoy exploring and committing as a team, you welcome others' ideas, and you value teamwork and team decision-making over being right and having things going your way.
-Result-oriented  - You manage the trade-offs between speed and quality and are able to find the right balance. You would rather ship, measure, learn and iterate, rather than code the perfect component on the first try.
-Resilient  - You can adapt and roll up your sleeves to help others. You operate at a stable pace with visibility most of the time and you are ready to embrace change when it happens.

Now that we’ve told you what the job looks like, here are the qualifications we're looking for in a candidate:      -Currently located in Europe, preferably Spain
-5+ years of experience building products in a multi-tenant SaaS environment
-Expertise in javascript, DOM, and web development
-Experience with web scraping, React, Typescript, Python, SQL, Postgres, or Clickhouse is a plus
-A predisposition for a fast-paced environment where we emphasize on delivering value for our customers, while learning, growing, and experimenting


So what can you expect after you apply? Your application will be personally reviewed by a member of the Beyond hiring team and if there is a match in your experience and the role, you will:      -Have a video conversation with someone on our Recruiting team. This is a high-level conversation about your experience and interest, but also an opportunity for you to learn more about us
-Meet with our Director of Engineering
-Complete a technical assessment relavant to the role
-Speak with our Engineers about the assessment
-Have a final interview with our VP of Engineering


Company Values:We are serious about our core values: We Care, We Are On the Same Team, We Inspire Trust, We Go Beyond, We Ship It, We're Curious. If those resonate with you, and you're ready to work with a team that lives and breathes those values, we want to hear from you.
Benefits:Beyond offers a wide variety of benefits like: stock options, unlimited PTO, private health insurance and more! You can learn more about our benefits by visiting our careers site!
We Care about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion:Beyond is committed to building a workplace that attracts humans of all genders, ethnicities, backgrounds, statuses and lifestyles. At our core, we care about our people and encourage every employee, partner and applicant to share their whole self with us. We are respectful of and empathetic towards different viewpoints, and believe that our ability to help short term rental managers succeed relies on us building a dynamic and diverse team. Whoever you are, you can Belong @ Beyond.
Any communication regarding job openings, interviews and/or offers will come from our @beyondpricing.com email domain

jobs_data.title: Software Development Engineer, Ring Device Services
jobs_data.description:
Description

Ring is looking for a Software Development Engineer who will help us create the next generation of apps, and services. In this role, you will work as a part of the Ring backend team working closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, and product managers to design, test, learn, and iterate on solutions in a fast-paced environment.

The Ring backend team is responsible for the heart of what drives the experiences our Neighbors use to interact with our doorbells, cameras, and other devices. As an engineer with the Ring backend team, you will get to build low-latency systems with the required uptime of a security system. You will also get to work alongside a talented team, invested in making each other successful, as well as building revolutionary features for our products.

Key job responsibilities

      -  Design and document distributed systems and microservices.
-  Implement robust and maintainable code with clear and maintained documentation.
-  Deliver customer value in iterative fashion while working towards longer term systems to solve roadmap goals with increasing efficiency.
-  Communicate status and changes to the work they are responsible and accountable for, keep all stakeholders informed of changes and updates to original plan.
-  Implement test automation on all code implemented through unit testing and integration testing.



Basic Qualifications

      -  Experience in professional, non-internship software development
-  Experience programming with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
-  Experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems
-  Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent



Preferred Qualifications

      -  Master's degree in computer science or equivalent
-  Knowledge of professional software engineering & best practices for full software development life cycle, including coding standards, software architectures, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing, and operational excellence
-  Full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience



Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company  - Amazon Spain Services, S.L.

jobs_data.title: Software Engineer (Hybrid)
jobs_data.description:
Location: Madrid, Spain

Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

Thales in Spain is a leader in technological solutions applied to Defence, Aeronautics, Security, Transportation and Space and, furthermore, is a global centre for excellence in Space, Security of Critical Infrastructures and Transportation. With a turnover of €320 million and a staff of 1,200, it exports approximately 40% of its total production principally to the Middle East, North Africa and Latin America.

Thales Digital Identity & Security is a global leader in digital security, bringing trust to an increasingly connected world. We design and deliver a wide range of products, software and services based on two core technologies: digital identification and data protection.

With the massive surge of electronic travel documents and national eID cards, Thales Digital & Security global business unit is supporting border agencies, government authorities and airports to exploit technology convergence to gain consistent, comprehensive border, visa management and document verification worldwide, that will:

      -Deliver seamless travel with border control applications
-Offer convenience for travelers for fast and secure border crossing
-Improve border intelligence for detection and prevention, including some of the most disruptive new technologies like biometrics, machine learning, or micro services.




If you’re looking for new opportunities, and ready to join a high-skilled multicultural team, we are now looking for a Java Technical Lead to join our Platform and Services Delivery team in Madrid.

What will you do?

      -You will participate in the design, implementation, security and validation of applications within a project team structure, in accordance with institutionalized processes and delivery standards.
-You will analyze customer requirements, perform feasibility study, provide technical proposal, estimate workload and contribute to project requirements specification.  
-You will collaborate in documentation related to these activities.  
-You will be a team player inside one of our agile teams.




About You

To succeed in this job, you must have: knowledge and at least 8 years of experience in software development including:

      -Java and J2EE. Knowledge of J2EE frameworks and libraries (Spring, Hibernate, JPA, JDBC)  
-Knowledge of Web technologies (HTTP, HTML, XML, REST, SOAP, JavaScript, jQuery, JSON), Angular 2+, Typescript, database servers - SQL (MS SQL, MySQL, Oracle), No SQL (Apache Cassandra, MongoDB).
-Knowledge of Microservices architecture, Message Brokers (Kafka, Zookeeper), Containers (Docker, Docker Compose, Docker Swarm).
-Experience in Source Control Systems, Continuous Integration Systems and Unit Testing Frameworks.
-Bacherlor's Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Telecommunications, or similar.  
-You are fluent in English and available to travel out of the country (maximum 15% of your time).




What do we offer?

      -Flexible working hours.
-Intensive working days on Fridays and during August.
-Remote-friendly - 2/3 days a week working from home.
-Restaurant allowance and social benefits (health insurance, kindergarten).
-Free coffee on-site!




Thales is a company committed to equal opportunities between women and men, and for this reason, we work to raise awareness and disseminate information on the subject both internally and externally.

At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

jobs_data.title: Developer
jobs_data.description:
Información general  

  Developer  

🌎  Sevilla, Ecija, Madrid, Granada, Lleida, Barcelona,  ESPAÑA

  👉    Teletrabajo    : bajo la política de Berger-Levrault España

Tipo de contrato  : contrato indefinido

Tiempo de trabajo: tiempo completo

  BERGER-LEVRAULT: TU FUTURO ESTÁ CON NOSOTROS  

Berger-Levrault es una compañía internacional de software con sede en Francia, al servicio de las administraciones locales, los centros sanitarios, el mundo de la educación y la industria. El Grupo tiene oficinas en Europa, Marruecos y Canadá y cuenta con 40.000 clientes en los 5 continentes.

Berger-Levrault es el proveedor líder de soluciones de gestión para la Gestión Financiera y la Gestión de Recursos Humanos en el sector público en Francia y España, así como el líder europeo en soluciones de gestión de mantenimiento.

Berger-Levrault es un socio local sólido y duradero, que trabaja con sus clientes y partners para hacer que el mundo sea más sencillo y confiable gracias a un entorno digital seguro y accesible para todos.

Comprometidos con la transformación digital responsable, los 2.000 empleados de Berger-Levrault trabajan a diario para responder a los retos sociales, económicos y medioambientales de sus clientes mediante la creación de soluciones digitales de confianza.

https://www.berger-levrault.com

🎥 ¿Tienes curiosidad por saber más sobre nosotros? Pulsa aquí .

  ¿CUÁLES SERÁN TUS FUNCIONES?    🤩

✨ ¿Te apasionan los  retos técnicos  ligados al desarrollo de herramientas que permiten la industrialización del despliegue de soluciones empresariales? ✨

Entonces, ven y únete a nuestro equipo "Industrial y Despliegue" encargado de optimizar la producción de nuestras aplicaciones. 🚀🚀

Dentro de la actividad de desarrollo de software de nuestras gamas de gestión, estamos buscando a una o un  developer  para reforzar el proceso de  transformación  de nuestras soluciones y para la actualización tecnológica de nuestra base de clientes. 🙌

Trabajarás en nuestra base de aplicaciones, el software que gestiona la  administración, el despliegue y el mantenimiento de las aplicaciones empresariales (contabilidad, nóminas, Administración Electrónica s, etc.) para nuestros clientes. 🤩

  ¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?    🤭

➡️ Tienes al menos  4 o 5 años de experiencia  profesional como developer.

➡️ Has estudiado  Informática.

➡️ Posees  conocimiento  en los siguientes campos:

      -Conocimientos web HTML5, CSS3, Javascript y JSP
-Familiarizado con Angular / React.js
-Experiencia en programación Java con framework Struts
-Herramientas: Git, Maven
-Servicios API Restful / Graphql
-Bases de datos SQL / NoSQL



➡️ También  valoraríamos  mucho lo siguiente:

      -Conocimientos de Diseño UX/UI
-Frameworks CSS: Materialize / Bootstrap
-Conocimientos GIS
-Librerías Javascript GIS: Openlayers / Leaflet / Mapbox / Carto / Google Maps API
-Integración contínua: Ansible, Jenkins
-Herramientas: npm, ESLint
-Test y debugging: p.e. Jest
-Metodología de trabajo: Agile / Scrum
-Experiencia con Docker
-Familiarizado con el stack ELK
-Cloud Computing: Experiencia o conocimientos en Amazon Web Services
-Programación: Node.js / .NET Core



➡️ Además, para este puesto necesitaríamos que tuvieras buena capacidad de  trabajo en equipo  en entornos ágiles y dinámicos. 🙌

  ¿CÓMO ES TU FUTURO EQUIPO?    🏡

  LO QUE OFRECEMOS TE VA A ENCANTAR…    🙌

Tu horario laboral

      -  ¿Teletrabajo? ¡Por supuesto! Híbrido o 100%, según la política de teletrabajo de Berger-Levrault España.  
-  Flexibilidad horaria y política de desconexión digital para asegurar un equilibrio óptimo entre vida personal y profesional.  
-  Jornada intensiva solo de mañana durante los tres meses de verano y en Navidad.  
-  Horario especial en Semana Santa, 24, 31 de diciembre y 5 de enero (de 9h a 14h).  
-  Posibilidad de trabajar solo 2 de las 5 tardes a la semana durante el horario de invierno.



Beneficios personales

      -  100% del salario desde el 1º día de baja (12 primeros meses).  
-  Posibilidad de anticipo en nómina.  
-  Dos días por mudanza.  
-  Tarde libre de cumpleaños.  
-  22 + 2 días de vacaciones.  
-  Regalo con incentivo en nómina si te casas.  



Conciliación familiar

      -  16 semanas + 1 semana extra de BL por nacimiento y cuidado del menor.  
-  Cuidado del lactante: 9h/semana en jornada de invierno y 5h/semana en jornada de verano.  
-  Plan familia para hijos con discapacidad.  
-  Permiso para asistir a tutorías escolares.  



  NUESTRO PROCESO DE SELECCIÓN:    ✨    UNA EXPERIENCIA ÚNICA Y TRANSPARENTE    ✨

Te explicamos cuáles son las etapas de este proceso de selección:

1 – Envíanos tu CV a través de esta oferta.

2 – Si tu perfil ha hecho que nos pique la curiosidad, Ana te llamará para saber un poco más sobre ti.

3 – Si hay match ❤️, te convocaremos a entrevista con el responsable de desarrollo, Luis Tubio.

4 – Tras esta entrevista, nos comprometemos a darte feedback, tanto positivo como negativo.

¡Así de fácil! 🥳

  La persona que se encarga de este proceso de selección es Ana Liñán , técnica de Capital Humano. ¡Y está deseando conocerte!  🥳

🤝    IGUALDAD,    DIVERSIDAD E INCLUSIÓN: LA CLAVE DE NUESTRO ÉXITO HUMANO  

Nos comprometemos a:

      -  Elaborar las ofertas y llevar a cabo los procesos de selección con total imparcialidad y no discriminación por razón de sexo, raza, religión o cualquier otra condición personal o social.  
-  Respetar la normativa vigente relativa a la igualdad de trato y de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres en el empleo y la ocupación (Real Decreto – ley 6/2019).  
-  Acoger e integrar a personas en situación de discapacidad.  
-  Promover una cultura de igualdad e inclusión en la empresa.  
-  Sensibilizar y acompañar a los equipos en materia de diversidad porque somos conscientes de que las características de cada persona nos enriquecen.  



  MÁS QUE UN TRABAJO, UNA AVENTURA    🚀

jobs_data.title: Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Hello Network!  
We are scouting for a CMDB Engineer with experience in ServiceNow. This position is fully remote for a German client over an initial duration of 6-12 months plus a high likelihood of extensions into 2026. If you or someone if your network could be interested, please apply on this post or contact me directly  @Rhys Howells.
<span class="tvm-operation__underline">CMDB Engineer  Location: Remote  Duration: 6-12 Months initial contract (plus extensions)  Europe: B2B Freelance (outside) / UK: Inside IR35  40 hours per week / Full-Time  
About the Role:  We are seeking a skilled CMDB Engineer to lead a critical initiative for our German client. This role involves cleaning up and implementing a robust CMDB within the ServiceNow platform. The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding of CMDB principles, automation techniques, and ServiceNow configuration.
<span class="tvm-operation__underline">Key Responsibilities:
      -CMDB Clean-up:  Conduct a thorough analysis of the existing CMDB to identify inconsistencies, redundancies, and errors.
-Data Quality Improvement:  Implement data quality standards and procedures to ensure accurate and reliable CMDB data.
-Automation:  Develop and execute automation scripts to streamline CMDB processes, such as data import, export, and reconciliation.
-ServiceNow Configuration:  Customize ServiceNow workflows, forms, and reports to optimize CMDB functionality.
-Relationship Mapping:  Establish and maintain accurate relationships between CI items to improve visibility and reporting.
-Best Practice Implementation:  Adhere to industry best practices for CMDB design, implementation, and maintenance.
-Collaboration:  Work closely with IT teams to understand their needs and ensure the CMDB aligns with their requirements.


<span class="tvm-operation__underline">Required Skills and Experience:
      -Proven experience in CMDB design, implementation, and maintenance
-Strong proficiency in ServiceNow, including configuration and scripting
-Solid understanding of ITIL processes, specifically Configuration Management
-Expertise in data cleansing and quality improvement techniques
-Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
-Strong attention to detail and accuracy
-Ability to work independently and as part of a team
-Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal


<span class="tvm-operation__underline">Desired Skills and Experience:
      -Experience with automation tools like PowerShell, Python, or JavaScript
-Knowledge of ITIL certifications (e.g., ITIL Foundation)
-Experience with cloud-based CMDB solutions


If interested in this role, please apply on this post or contact me directly at  @Rhys Howells .

jobs_data.title: Data Software Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Desde LHH nos encontramos en búsqueda de dos Data Engineers para uno de nuestro clientes más importantes:
Área:  DataUbicación: Barcelona/MadridEmpresa:  cliente final del sector Financiero
Descripción de la oferta
Buscamos personas  curiosas  y  comprometidas. Personas que buscan  crecer, pero, sobre todo,  mejorar  el entorno de los empleados de nuestro cliente. ¿Eres una de ellas? Entonces, ¡esta oferta es para ti!
¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?Damos servicio a todas las áreas mediante una infraestructura de autoservicio que permite utilizar recursos y herramientas de analítica del dato para tomar decisiones estratégicas y dar mayor certeza en sus planes de acción.Nos encargamos de dar soporte, entender las necesidades del negocio y darles la mejor solución con la implantación de soluciones escalables dentro del ámbito de Data.A nivel entidad, estamos embarcados en el camino hacia el Cloud que llevará el entorno de datos corporativo y el desarrollo de los casos de uso analíticos a nuevas plataformas y paradigmas.Con nosotros podrás realizar proyectos con las tecnologías más punteras en el ámbito de la Analítica Avanzada y del Dato en general.Todo ello dentro de un equipo multidisciplinar y orientado a metodología de trabajo agile.
Cómo será tu día a día…      -Programación y desarrollo de herramientas y aplicaciones para la futura plataforma analítica del grupo.
-Participar en el diseño de soluciones y colaborar en la implantación en un entorno multidisciplinar
-Documentar el trabajo utilizando estándares, métodos y herramientas adecuadas.
-Realizar revisiones de código para el fomento de buenas prácticas de desarrollo.
-Desarrollo integral de software comprendiendo todo el ciclo de vida: revisión de requerimientos, análisis de la solución, programación y pruebas, revisión del incidental y evolución


Requisitos y competencias clave:      -Formación/Titulación: Ingeniería Informática/Telecomunicaciones. Matemáticas, Física o equivalentes.
-Experiencia demostrable en programación orientada a backends en Python y/o Java (preferiblemente ambas).
-Experiencia con integración a BBDD (BigQuery, Cloud SQL, BigTable, Oracle, etc.) y sistemas de cloud storage (GCS, S3, etc). Se valorará también conocimientos de BBDD NoSQL (Elastic, MongoDB).
-Conocimiento en plataformas de integración, gestor de colas y tiempo real (Kafka, Pub/Sub, Kinesis, Flink, Spark Streaming, Apache Beam, etc.).
-Conocimientos y experiencia en entornos cloud (preferiblemente GCP).
-Experiencia práctica en el uso de técnicas, metodologías para el control de versiones.
-Experiencia en colaboración con proyecto de implementación/evolución de arquitecturas Big Data y/o de IA.
-Preferible haber trabajado con metodologías ágiles (Scrum, Kanban o similares) y herramientas de gestión (Clarity PPM, Confluence, Jira…).



Si te apasiona…  
El mundo del dato y todo lo que supone la construcción de software y modelos de explotación a su alrededor, estás en el sitio adecuado ya que estamos en el proceso de construcción de la nueva plataforma informacional y analítica en Cloud.

jobs_data.title: Full Stack Software Engineer - Frontend Focus
jobs_data.description:
At Beyond, we power the business of Short Term Rentals through our cutting-edge, full-stack Revenue Management System. Venture-backed, we pioneered this space and have grown to be the globally dominant leader - obsessed with delivering value and performance to our customers. And the way we've been able to achieve those heights is our belief that People are the most important part of any business - starting with ours. We employ over 170 Beyonders across the globe who share in our commitment to making Beyond the best place to work.
As a Fullstack Engineer with Beyond, you will have the opportunity to build the next evolution of our SaaS-based product as well as work on new products. Because you will be working with a successful team that is completely remote, excellent coding and communication skills are key. This is a great opportunity for someone to work closely with the entire product life cycle from concept to go-to-market! If you enjoy rolling up your sleeves and jumping in, then read on!
Before reading further...Beyond is passionate about diversity and cultivating our team’s potential. If you’re hungry for a good opportunity, but don't meet every point in this job description, please apply anyway!
Our team believes in:      -Reducing scope  - The best way to control progress and test hypotheses is to prevent scope creep;
-Shipping early  - The best way to learn early is to ship early. No need to be perfect;
-Iterating and improving  - Once we get the feedback we need, we iterate and improve;
-Taking ownership  - The code we ship is our responsibility as we know it best;
-Delivering value  - By focussing on providing the best customer experience, we improve acquisition and retention and drive revenue.


As our  Full Stack Software Engineer, you'll be responsible for:      -Collaborating with your peers from product, design, and engineering on a cross-functional, outcome-based team to craft and deliver on OKRs
-Helping drive your team through large projects autonomously, while continuously assessing and communicating progress and iterating on solutions.
-Collaborating and recommending architectural solutions, while understanding and explaining trade-offs around time to market, structural and functional quality, security, maintainability, resources, and scope.
-Supporting and maintaining the existing code baseline and products.
-Exercising and improving Beyond’s engineering practices such as refactoring, pairing, code reviews, collective code ownership, containers, IaC, CI/CD, observability.


So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? The person who will be successful in this role will be:      -Curious  - You are driven to understand how things work or why they don't. You are interested in finding out how your work impacts our customers and the world they live in.
-Collaborative  - You enjoy exploring and committing as a team, you welcome others' ideas, and you value teamwork and team decision-making over being right and having things going your way.
-Result-oriented  - You manage the trade-offs between speed and quality and are able to find the right balance. You would rather ship, measure, learn and iterate, rather than code the perfect component on the first try.
-Resilient  - You can adapt and roll up your sleeves to help others. You operate at a stable pace with visibility most of the time and you are ready to embrace change when it happens.

Now that we’ve told you what the job looks like, here are the qualifications we're looking for in a candidate:      -Currently located in Europe, preferably Spain
-5+ years of experience building products in a multi-tenant SaaS environment
-Expertise in javascript, DOM, and web development
-Experience with web scraping, React, Typescript, Python, SQL, Postgres, or Clickhouse is a plus
-A predisposition for a fast-paced environment where we emphasize on delivering value for our customers, while learning, growing, and experimenting


So what can you expect after you apply? Your application will be personally reviewed by a member of the Beyond hiring team and if there is a match in your experience and the role, you will:      -Have a video conversation with someone on our Recruiting team. This is a high-level conversation about your experience and interest, but also an opportunity for you to learn more about us
-Meet with our Director of Engineering
-Complete a technical assessment relavant to the role
-Speak with our Engineers about the assessment
-Have a final interview with our VP of Engineering


Company Values:We are serious about our core values: We Care, We Are On the Same Team, We Inspire Trust, We Go Beyond, We Ship It, We're Curious. If those resonate with you, and you're ready to work with a team that lives and breathes those values, we want to hear from you.
Benefits:Beyond offers a wide variety of benefits like: stock options, unlimited PTO, private health insurance and more! You can learn more about our benefits by visiting our careers site!
We Care about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion:Beyond is committed to building a workplace that attracts humans of all genders, ethnicities, backgrounds, statuses and lifestyles. At our core, we care about our people and encourage every employee, partner and applicant to share their whole self with us. We are respectful of and empathetic towards different viewpoints, and believe that our ability to help short term rental managers succeed relies on us building a dynamic and diverse team. Whoever you are, you can Belong @ Beyond.
Any communication regarding job openings, interviews and/or offers will come from our @beyondpricing.com email domain

jobs_data.description:
Description

Ring is looking for a Software Development Engineer who will help us create the next generation of apps, and services. In this role, you will work as a part of the Ring backend team working closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, and product managers to design, test, learn, and iterate on solutions in a fast-paced environment.

The Ring backend team is responsible for the heart of what drives the experiences our Neighbors use to interact with our doorbells, cameras, and other devices. As an engineer with the Ring backend team, you will get to build low-latency systems with the required uptime of a security system. You will also get to work alongside a talented team, invested in making each other successful, as well as building revolutionary features for our products.

Key job responsibilities

      -  Design and document distributed systems and microservices.
-  Implement robust and maintainable code with clear and maintained documentation.
-  Deliver customer value in iterative fashion while working towards longer term systems to solve roadmap goals with increasing efficiency.
-  Communicate status and changes to the work they are responsible and accountable for, keep all stakeholders informed of changes and updates to original plan.
-  Implement test automation on all code implemented through unit testing and integration testing.

-  Experience programming with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

Preferred Qualifications

-  Full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience



Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. jobs_data.title: Software Engineer (Hybrid)
jobs_data.description:
Location: Madrid, Spain

Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

Thales in Spain is a leader in technological solutions applied to Defence, Aeronautics, Security, Transportation and Space and, furthermore, is a global centre for excellence in Space, Security of Critical Infrastructures and Transportation. With a turnover of €320 million and a staff of 1,200, it exports approximately 40% of its total production principally to the Middle East, North Africa and Latin America.

Thales Digital Identity & Security is a global leader in digital security, bringing trust to an increasingly connected world. We design and deliver a wide range of products, software and services based on two core technologies: digital identification and data protection.

With the massive surge of electronic travel documents and national eID cards, Thales Digital & Security global business unit is supporting border agencies, government authorities and airports to exploit technology convergence to gain consistent, comprehensive border, visa management and document verification worldwide, that will:

      -Deliver seamless travel with border control applications
-Offer convenience for travelers for fast and secure border crossing
-Improve border intelligence for detection and prevention, including some of the most disruptive new technologies like biometrics, machine learning, or micro services.




If you’re looking for new opportunities, and ready to join a high-skilled multicultural team, we are now looking for a Java Technical Lead to join our Platform and Services Delivery team in Madrid.

What will you do?

      -You will participate in the design, implementation, security and validation of applications within a project team structure, in accordance with institutionalized processes and delivery standards.
-You will analyze customer requirements, perform feasibility study, provide technical proposal, estimate workload and contribute to project requirements specification.  
-You will collaborate in documentation related to these activities.  
-You will be a team player inside one of our agile teams.




About You

To succeed in this job, you must have: knowledge and at least 8 years of experience in software development including:

      -Java and J2EE. Knowledge of J2EE frameworks and libraries (Spring, Hibernate, JPA, JDBC)  
-Knowledge of Web technologies (HTTP, HTML, XML, REST, SOAP, JavaScript, jQuery, JSON), Angular 2+, Typescript, database servers - SQL (MS SQL, MySQL, Oracle), No SQL (Apache Cassandra, MongoDB).
-Knowledge of Microservices architecture, Message Brokers (Kafka, Zookeeper), Containers (Docker, Docker Compose, Docker Swarm).
-Experience in Source Control Systems, Continuous Integration Systems and Unit Testing Frameworks.
-Bacherlor's Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Telecommunications, or similar.  
-You are fluent in English and available to travel out of the country (maximum 15% of your time).




What do we offer?

      -Flexible working hours.
-Intensive working days on Fridays and during August.
-Remote-friendly - 2/3 days a week working from home.
-Restaurant allowance and social benefits (health insurance, kindergarten).
-Free coffee on-site!




Thales is a company committed to equal opportunities between women and men, and for this reason, we work to raise awareness and disseminate information on the subject both internally and externally.

At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

  ¿CUÁLES SERÁN TUS FUNCIONES?    🤩

✨ ¿Te apasionan los  retos técnicos  ligados al desarrollo de herramientas que permiten la industrialización del despliegue de soluciones empresariales? ✨

Entonces, ven y únete a nuestro equipo "Industrial y Despliegue" encargado de optimizar la producción de nuestras aplicaciones. 🚀🚀

Dentro de la actividad de desarrollo de software de nuestras gamas de gestión, estamos buscando a una o un  developer  para reforzar el proceso de  transformación  de nuestras soluciones y para la actualización tecnológica de nuestra base de clientes. 🙌

Trabajarás en nuestra base de aplicaciones, el software que gestiona la  administración, el despliegue y el mantenimiento de las aplicaciones empresariales (contabilidad, nóminas, Administración Electrónica s, etc.) para nuestros clientes. 🤩

  ¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?    🤭

➡️ Tienes al menos  4 o 5 años de experiencia  profesional como developer.

➡️ Has estudiado  Informática.

➡️ Posees  conocimiento  en los siguientes campos:

      -Conocimientos web HTML5, CSS3, Javascript y JSP
-Familiarizado con Angular / React.js
-Experiencia en programación Java con framework Struts
-Herramientas: Git, Maven
-Servicios API Restful / Graphql
-Bases de datos SQL / NoSQL



➡️ También  valoraríamos  mucho lo siguiente:

      -Conocimientos de Diseño UX/UI
-Frameworks CSS: Materialize / Bootstrap
-Conocimientos GIS
-Librerías Javascript GIS: Openlayers / Leaflet / Mapbox / Carto / Google Maps API
-Integración contínua: Ansible, Jenkins
-Herramientas: npm, ESLint
-Test y debugging: p.e. Jest
-Metodología de trabajo: Agile / Scrum
-Experiencia con Docker
-Familiarizado con el stack ELK
-Cloud Computing: Experiencia o conocimientos en Amazon Web Services
-Programación: Node.js / .NET Core



➡️ Además, para este puesto necesitaríamos que tuvieras buena capacidad de  trabajo en equipo  en entornos ágiles y dinámicos. 🙌

  ¿CÓMO ES TU FUTURO EQUIPO?    🏡

  LO QUE OFRECEMOS TE VA A ENCANTAR…    🙌

Tu horario laboral

      -  ¿Teletrabajo? ¡Por supuesto! Híbrido o 100%, según la política de teletrabajo de Berger-Levrault España.  
-  Flexibilidad horaria y política de desconexión digital para asegurar un equilibrio óptimo entre vida personal y profesional.  
-  Jornada intensiva solo de mañana durante los tres meses de verano y en Navidad.  
-  Horario especial en Semana Santa, 24, 31 de diciembre y 5 de enero (de 9h a 14h).  
-  Posibilidad de trabajar solo 2 de las 5 tardes a la semana durante el horario de invierno.



Beneficios personales

      -  100% del salario desde el 1º día de baja (12 primeros meses).  
-  Posibilidad de anticipo en nómina.  
-  Dos días por mudanza.  
-  Tarde libre de cumpleaños.  
-  22 + 2 días de vacaciones.  
-  Regalo con incentivo en nómina si te casas.  



Conciliación familiar

      -  16 semanas + 1 semana extra de BL por nacimiento y cuidado del menor.  
-  Cuidado del lactante: 9h/semana en jornada de invierno y 5h/semana en jornada de verano.  
-  Plan familia para hijos con discapacidad.  
-  Permiso para asistir a tutorías escolares.  



  NUESTRO PROCESO DE SELECCIÓN:    ✨    UNA EXPERIENCIA ÚNICA Y TRANSPARENTE    ✨

Te explicamos cuáles son las etapas de este proceso de selección:

1 – Envíanos tu CV a través de esta oferta.

2 – Si tu perfil ha hecho que nos pique la curiosidad, Ana te llamará para saber un poco más sobre ti.

3 – Si hay match ❤️, te convocaremos a entrevista con el responsable de desarrollo, Luis Tubio.

4 – Tras esta entrevista, nos comprometemos a darte feedback, tanto positivo como negativo.

¡Así de fácil! 🥳

  La persona que se encarga de este proceso de selección es Ana Liñán , técnica de Capital Humano. ¡Y está deseando conocerte!  🥳

🤝    IGUALDAD,    DIVERSIDAD E INCLUSIÓN: LA CLAVE DE NUESTRO ÉXITO HUMANO  

Nos comprometemos a:

      -  Elaborar las ofertas y llevar a cabo los procesos de selección con total imparcialidad y no discriminación por razón de sexo, raza, religión o cualquier otra condición personal o social.  
-  Respetar la normativa vigente relativa a la igualdad de trato y de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres en el empleo y la ocupación (Real Decreto – ley 6/2019).  
-  Acoger e integrar a personas en situación de discapacidad.  
-  Promover una cultura de igualdad e inclusión en la empresa.  
-  Sensibilizar y acompañar a los equipos en materia de diversidad porque somos conscientes de que las características de cada persona nos enriquecen.  



  MÁS QUE UN TRABAJO, UNA AVENTURA    🚀

jobs_data.title: Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Hello Network!  
We are scouting for a CMDB Engineer with experience in ServiceNow. This position is fully remote for a German client over an initial duration of 6-12 months plus a high likelihood of extensions into 2026. If you or someone if your network could be interested, please apply on this post or contact me directly  @Rhys Howells.
<span class="tvm-operation__underline">CMDB Engineer  Location: Remote  Duration: 6-12 Months initial contract (plus extensions)  Europe: B2B Freelance (outside) / UK: Inside IR35  40 hours per week / Full-Time  
About the Role:  We are seeking a skilled CMDB Engineer to lead a critical initiative for our German client. This role involves cleaning up and implementing a robust CMDB within the ServiceNow platform. The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding of CMDB principles, automation techniques, and ServiceNow configuration.
<span class="tvm-operation__underline">Key Responsibilities:
      -CMDB Clean-up:  Conduct a thorough analysis of the existing CMDB to identify inconsistencies, redundancies, and errors.
-Data Quality Improvement:  Implement data quality standards and procedures to ensure accurate and reliable CMDB data.
-Automation:  Develop and execute automation scripts to streamline CMDB processes, such as data import, export, and reconciliation.
-ServiceNow Configuration:  Customize ServiceNow workflows, forms, and reports to optimize CMDB functionality.
-Relationship Mapping:  Establish and maintain accurate relationships between CI items to improve visibility and reporting.
-Best Practice Implementation:  Adhere to industry best practices for CMDB design, implementation, and maintenance.
-Collaboration:  Work closely with IT teams to understand their needs and ensure the CMDB aligns with their requirements.


<span class="tvm-operation__underline">Required Skills and Experience:
      -Proven experience in CMDB design, implementation, and maintenance
-Strong proficiency in ServiceNow, including configuration and scripting
-Solid understanding of ITIL processes, specifically Configuration Management
-Expertise in data cleansing and quality improvement techniques
-Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
-Strong attention to detail and accuracy
-Ability to work independently and as part of a team
-Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal


<span class="tvm-operation__underline">Desired Skills and Experience:
      -Experience with automation tools like PowerShell, Python, or JavaScript
-Knowledge of ITIL certifications (e.g., ITIL Foundation)
-Experience with cloud-based CMDB solutions


If interested in this role, please apply on this post or contact me directly at  @Rhys Howells .

jobs_data.title: Solution Engineer, Pre-Sales - EMEA
jobs_data.description: BforeAI is an innovative and rapidly expanding scale-up dedicated to deterring cybercrime through cutting-edge predictive and pre-emptive technologies. We harness the power of prescriptive AI to revolutionize the way we tackle cyber threats, particularly in the realm of brand protection. Named by Gartner in 26 reports over the last 2 years, BforeAI is the industry’s fastest, most accurate solution for automated protection against online fraud. We are like weather forecasts for cyber threats. Join us in the fight for a safer cyberspace! 🚀 Why it’s great to work here We are a location independent company – no physical office – and we operate as a fully distributed team. We deeply believe in the value of diversity and inclusion within our workplace, understanding that these principles lead to a happier team and ultimately a superior product. We offer an intellectually stimulating company environment and you’ll be working with a bright, dedicated team from across the globe. If you possess a high level of autonomy and self-organization, and feel you can thrive at BforeAI, we’d love to hear from you! ✨ What’s Cool About This Job As a Solution Engineer, you'll be right in the mix, helping our prospects and customers make the most of our technology every step of the way. This is an outward facing role, and you will represent BforeAI - communication and professional attitude are paramount. You’ll work with teams across the customer organization to identify the right mix of tools and techniques to translate client’s needs and goals into a plan that will enable secure and effective solutions. We need to come up with the best solutions, so you’ll investigate new techniques, break free from the legacy model, and go where the industry is going. As a team, we’ll take a critical approach to design, providing alternatives and customizing solutions to maintain a balance of security and efficiency. Please note, this job can be anywhere in EMEA - we have to select a country for job boards. 📣 What You’ll Be Doing Collaborating closely with sales, pre-sales, customer success and development teams, you will: -Evangelize the benefits of predictive capability, how it works, the value it delivers -Engage with customers to understand their technology stack, tools they are using, preferred integrations, etc. to provide a technology overview to sales -Assist prospect and customer personnel to integrate PreCrime in their tooling -Design and develop scripts and API integrations in a variety of environments -Act as a program manager for complex proof-of-value projects and design of experiments -Identify opportunities to improve API interfaces, and feed input to product teams -At times, provide introductory pitch to BforeAI capabilities and products -Create a repeatable demo environment, that will show the customer value of our predictive intelligence prior to entering into the proof of value phase -Respond in a timely manner to customers and prospects queries -Document each project to drive standardization and recycling of solutions -Train partners technical personnel to drive autonomy in prospecting new customers -Engage with customer success to support API integration activities post their onboarding phase 💥 You’ll be a great fit if -You have successful experience as a technical consultant, technical pre-sales engineer, solution architect, or in a customer/partner-facing role. -You understand networking infrastructure, DNS protocols, security tools, cloud hosting architectures, and integration use cases. -You have experience with Python scripting and possess programming skills and experience for developing integrations. -You have excellent communication skills, with the ability to conduct high level technical discussions and customer engagements. Written and oral communication skills in English are required, additional European languages are considered a plus. -You have the ability to collaborate with different teams to understand business needs, and to work independently. -You've got great problem-solving skills. -You demonstrate a robust technical aptitude and a knack for swiftly grasping new concepts. A willingness to learn and adapt to emerging technologies is essential. -Your expertise lies in cybersecurity market knowledge along with a keen understanding of industry trends and opportunities. Don't meet every single requirement? Don't count yourself out just yet. Studies show some individuals are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. At Bfore.Ai, we're dedicated to building a diverse workplace based on merit, work ethics, and character, and we believe everyone deserves a fair shot at success! If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we hope you’ll still consider applying! Candidates for this role must be based in EMEA. We use an Employer of Record service to facilitate seamless global hiring processes and offer benefits tailored to the country where you will be working! For countries not supported by our EOR partner, talk to us about being a contractor. In all cases, you will need to be authorized to work in the country you’re based in. - All salary bands listed are Cost to Company (CTC). Final gross salary offers will be localized based on the candidate's country of residence, accounting for tax structures, and statutory benefits. 💡 Want to know more about BforeAI -About BforeAI -BforeAI on YouTube -Our Values & Benefits at BforeAI -BforeAI Gartner® Recognition in Emerging Tech Reports -BforeAI Named in Four 2023 Gartner® Reports -Our CPO Luciano Allegro highlights the importance of a proactive cybersecurity approach in a recent TechNewsWorld article -Our CEO Luigi Lenguito on Pre-crime Threat Intelligence

jobs_data.title: Automation QA Engineer (English from Australia or Canada)
jobs_data.description:
About Us

M47 Labs is an AI Engineering company focused on providing businesses with the latest and most advanced Artificial Intelligence solutions. Our deep expertise in AI-Language Technologies, including NLP and LLMs, empowers businesses with custom-built cutting-edge solutions. We are dedicated to creating AI-driven applications that can understand, interpret, and respond to human language. Join us in making the future more intelligent.

About You

In line with M47’s exciting growth, we are on the quest for tech-savvy professionals  native in English (from Australia or Canada)  who are interested in working with cutting-edge Personal Voice Assistant software used by millions of users worldwide, with one of our major clients.

About your day-to-day:

      -Hands-on software quality assurance and product testing through test case automation, including triaging and scripting.
-Investigating and scoping out complex software bugs and key quality issues.
-Drive automation initiatives through completion, enabling the automation of test cases across different languages.
-Develop tools and metrics that will facilitate the triage of software issues and KPI tracking.




What is in it for you?

💪🏽 Indefinite Contract

☀️ Office located at the heart of Madrid

🚀 Follow your career ambition with growth opportunities (horizontal and vertical)

📚On-demand learning budget and ongoing educational company-wide training of relevant topics of our industry

💸 Comprehensive compensation package, including private medical insurance, expert tax support, coverage and flexible remuneration through Cobee, including meals and transport

🌈 Be part of our diverse communities and enjoy our meet-ups (Women in Tech, LGTBQ+, Wellbeing, City Lifestyle...)

🌍 Great international, inclusive and dynamic work environment (more than 20 nationalities!)

What you'll need:

      -Native knowledge of English (from Australia or Canada)
-Fluent level of English (written and spoken)
-Strong command of Python, Java, C# or Swift
-You are experienced in using testing automation testing frameworks.
-2+ years of automation testing experience.
-Experience with client-server environments and knowledge of the SDLC
-High adaptability to respond and react to changing priorities quickly and efficiently
-Exceptional analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
-Openness to learn new technologies, software, platforms...




What's nice to have:

      -API and other backend services testing experience.
-Comfortable working in a Mac environment and experience with Xcode
-Familiarity with debugging iOS or Android platforms
-Experience with GIT or other version control systems
-Drive for innovation




Special requirement

For this position, you must be a holder of a valid working permit for Spain (or EU passport) and be available to work full-time onsite.

**M47 Labs not only encourages but is actively working on empowering its diverse and inclusive talent. M47 Labs is committed to ensure a non-discriminative workplace, work life and selection process and such decisions will not be influenced by race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, social and conjugal status, age or other applicable characteristics. M47 Labs prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business needs.**

In accordance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of 27 April (GDPR) and the Organic Law 3/2018 of 5 December (LOPDGDD), we inform you that personal data and email addresses collected from the Data Subject will be processed under the responsibility of M47 LABS & INTERNATIONAL FIDUCIA SL for a legitimate interest and for the purpose of sending communications about our products and services and will be retained for as long as none of the parties object. The data will not be communicated to third parties, unless under legal obligation. You can exercise your rights of access, rectification, portability and erasure of your data and those of restriction and objection to their processing by contacting DIPUTACIÓ, 279 4 4 - 08007 BARCELONA (Barcelona). E-mail: info@m47labs.com. If you consider that the processing does not comply with current legislation, you may file a complaint with the Spanish supervisory authority at www.aepd.es.
